Jbn5qWPCeEHt6LDSeV_npA.text: One of the top two steakhouses in London. Order the porterhouse off the board for a unique dinner. It is also located in a great location of London to explore before and after your meal.

jeZvhgUgK3i71c75eQ2_wA.text: I've always heard great things about the hawksmoor and I have to say it deserves every single one of those reviews. The staff were very attentive and helpful and really made you feel like they were going the extra mile We had the rib to start which was out of this world and had minimal bone, it was outstanding.The fillet steak I had for dinner was also polished off.Make sure you book in advance to avoid disappointment

MByMb37ZZcshO4OXYpBaxA.text: Some of the best steaks I've ever had; perfectly done medium rare t-bone, filet mignon and ribs with a tasty sear, delicious lobsters, creamy Mac n cheese.Love the vibe and ambience of the restaurant. Highly recommend for small or bigger groups ( we were a group of 10)

8HOGeP4kW4n1rVVfRTqxLQ.text: This place is as good as it gets for steak. At least it is good as I have ever been able to get steak.The atmosphere and decor is fine. The place is pretty tastefully done out and the staff reasonably attentive. But you go for the food.I know nothing about steak and can't even remember the name of the cut that I ate in the end, but the full distinctive flavour and the tenderness of the texture is still with me.Go to Hawksmoor. Just go.

9faAPfDfbablgqOxst24PA.text: Booked to come here for dinner for a friend's bridal shower as she absolutely loves a good steak! Everyone commented on how wonderful the food was. We had the express menu as we were going on to a show after. My steak was perfect (as it is every time) and my friend is still waxing lyrical about the graceburn from the tomato salad. The bone marrow with onions was delicious and the sticky toffee pudding was a perfect end to the meal. Service was attentive and efficient- thank you to the staff for managing our large party so well. Absolutely my go to place in London for steak. I wouldn't even bother trying anywhere else.

stWdn_L-WrrW0Ke3JNmggQ.text: Hands down, the best meal my husband and I ate in London!  He happened to be celebrating his birthday while we were there, and I wanted to make it special, so I made reservations here for a pre theater (or, should I say, theatre) dinner.  We were seated promptly when we arrived (we did have a reservation) and the service was fantastic.They have a great wine list, and if you're a carnivore, then you've come to the right place.  We each had fillet, cooked to order, and shared the creamed spinach, mashed potatoes and bread and butter.  We shared the sticky toffee pudding for dessert and then practically had to be rolled up to street level and down to the theater to catch our show.  I recommend this place one thousand percent, and will definitely make a return trip the next time I'm in London.

LuJWeJ1Vp7E-jEN_gw50ag.text: Excellent location, we got our last minute show tickets for Matilda @6PM, walked over to Hawksmoor without reservations, and told them we'll be out by 7:30PM and was immediately seated. The bone-in prime rib was excellent, not as fatty as American corn fed beef but more tasteful, side dishes and desert are excellent and fast, the waiters knew we're in a hurry and in 1.5 hr we're out with a very satisfying meal. The decor and ambiance was formal yet relaxing, the service was proficient and after a long day of walking around London it's a great place to eat, relax and get ready to see the 7:30 shows. It's a bit overpriced though, for the same steak you can have in NYC for 2/3, and in France for 1/2 the price, but i guess you pay for the location & their excellent service (the staffs & services are as professional as any we've seen), hence the 4 stars.

DqOShhAsoPwWuC3iIKIAEQ.text: Thank you. Thank you for giving me back my faith in food in London. The bone in prime rib was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The buttered greens and wild mushrooms were perfection as well. The Mac and cheese and sweet potatoes were creamy and crunchy at the same time. I would come back every day if my heart can take it. :)

HOv3pcFBqhVHiO8hrmHHRg.text: I've been to many restaurants in the city of London, but will say this is by far the best place I've been to for a Sunday roast. American here, lived in the UK for 8 months and was impressed with the service provided, the drinks are on point, and the food is extraordinary! Going back to London in a few days and this is absolutely on my list of places to visit! Will recommend to anyone of my friends who visit this city!

zGOaCQjjR1v0xU0F4bjxlw.text: After trying a couple of steak-houses in London I grew tired of average quality, poorly cooked meat. Fortunately, the Hawksmoor managed to change my mind. Book a table for four at 9.30, had to wait a little in the bar (10 mins) and we're then given the menu. WOW. They don't have extraordinary variety or pretentious complex dishes - just what you want from a steakhouse: a few cuts of wonderful meat. You can get Chateaubriand , Porterhouse, T-Bone, Sirloin, Fillet, D-Rump (aged 55 days!) and Ribeye. A blackboard shows which "big" cut is still available and in which weight. Since my friends weren't up for sharing a very big cut, I went for a 750g T-Bone. I have to say, it's hard to beat that meat quality - just amazingly good, marbled to the right point, extremely tender: good job!So, why not 5 stars? Well, when ordering, the waiter asked (of course) how I'd like my steak, and it looked "confused" when I asked for it to be rare. A bit disappointing, a steak house should suggest a rare-ish cooking, not act like I'm some sort of alien when I order it like this. Anyway, not much of a problem there, I'm not too much picky on service quality when in a stakehouse. After 40 minutes or so (a bit too much, has to be said) we finally receive our piece of meat - I immediately cut it in the middle and - shame - it's almost cooked to medium: no blood, color is pink, not-so-juicy. On the bright side, the waiter saw my disappointed expression and immediately offered to replace my steak (big +1 to service this time). Unfortunately, since it took 40mins the first time and it was already 10.30pm, I decided to keep it like it was and I must say, even with the wrong cooking, it was amazing!Side note: two of my friends order other cuts cooked rare, and their stake was done properly, so I suppose I was unlucky.Now on the wine side - wine list is quite nourished, varying from South-america to Spain, France and Italy. A bit overpriced but in the average of mid-high level restaurant. They also have a rather good selection of wines by the glass, which is always very welcome if you're dining with someone who's not a wine lover Conclusion: best steak I've had in London so far, looking forward to come again for a properly cooked porterhouse, and maybe a 5-star review!

yjj1vjP36qoH8ckoTbQa2A.text: Oh, as if this even needs to be said. Writing this review feels like the equivalent of a supermodel asking you "am I pretty?" YES. YOU ARE GODDAMN GORGEOUS AND YOU KNOW IT. Dudes, that burger is gorgeous. It really is. I was surprised when I was told I could only order it medium or well done. I like my burgers medium rare. But the meat was plenty pink when I got it. The chips were good, too, but honestly the burger is so filling you hardly need them. I washed it all down with a Shaky Pete's, which is one of my new favorite drinks. I wish there were more places I could casually stop in to drink one of these. Mmm. My partner's steak was insane. Since he was going to be eating it alone, he didn't get one of the crazy big cuts, but it was still a lot of meat. He had the mashed potatoes, as well, which were whipped to perfection. I can't even say anything here that hasn't been covered. Monday night is BYO £5 corkage fee, so if you're looking to try the burger but you're on a budget, I'd recommend getting there early to get a table at the bar and bringing your own wine. I'm trying to space out my visits for the sake of not being a fat drunk (seriously, the shaky petes pack a legitimate booze punch), but, along with everyone else. I'd recommend Hawksmoor. Five stars because the staff is so welcoming and awesome and, for a slightly more expensive dining option, I didn't feel totally out of place walking in with my fashion backpack filled with gym clothes. The vibe is really chilled out.

s2xrUAh6ZAjNai0FJDW1Ow.text: A big fan of both Hawksmoor locations, I prefer this one for group meals. The large round tables and expansive dining room just lend themselves to conversation (and sharing!)After multiple visits, I'm firm in the belief that Hawksmoor do the best Sunday roast in London. Think thick slabs of Longhorn beef rump, all the vegetable trimmings (plus huge Yorkshire puds!) and gravy that's absolutely bursting with umami.On my last visit, four of us split two Sunday roasts with added sides of macaroni cheese, beef dripping chips, buttered spinach and the English lettuce and herb salad, plus puddings, and there was plenty of food to go around. The food is faultless but the bloody marys can be uneven and if you like yours spicy you'll need to ask for the Tabasco and generously apply. I partook of the bottomless bloodies and the first one arrived beautifully done with a salt rimmed glass. The subsequent ones? Not so much. Hawksmoor could stand to apply some consistency in this department.Booking is essential. After all, this is the best Sunday lunch in town!

WlPdZid_vMyYAiiv5VYdqw.text: Went with some visitors from overseas for a traditional English Sunday roast. The food was excellent and the setting is lovely but the thing we liked the most was the outstanding service. We arrived with some shopping bags that they offered to put in the cloak room. All of the restaurant staff we friendly, helpful and attentive. A total breath of fresh air for London!They do a pre-theatre menu before 6.30 pm that looks like excellent value.Will definitely be back!

3W7k2w1I2hMqLrOH5rh_ug.text: Took my girlfriend here for a birthday treat and was NOT disappointed. Truly an exceptional restaurant and well worth the price tag.Started with the infamous Shaky Petes shandy cocktail and Seasonal cobbler which were outstanding.The crab on toast reignited my love for the dish where previous restaurants have failed miserably. Even the simple garnish salad was special. The Tamworth ribs fell apart in my mouth like a dream but were surprisingly spicy.We ordered the bone in prime rib. 850grams was enough for us and was simply devine. Smokey bark on the outside and juicy in the middle. The macaroni cheese was a particular highlight of the sides, every mouthful was better than the last.Staff were super attentive and knowledgable, were always there when you needed them and never when you didn't. Atmosphere was buzzing but not rowdy despite being essentially fully booked on a Monday night.One of my all time favourites. A real special place.

ZOTTnUIw8TUzM1WLio72YQ.text: I came to Hawksmoors with high expectations.  It was my boyfriends birthday and I really wanted a special night out.  It did not disappoint.  I noted during booking that it was my guests birthday and upon finishing our devine steaks,  they brought out a place of their amazing chocolate rolos with a sweet happy birthday message and a few candles.  If you love salted caramel,  I do,  you need to try these chocolate rolos.  There is a nice bar area to have drinks before being seated at your table.  We enjoyed this feature and were brought to our table after enjoying a drink.  We enjoyed the dumplings and scallops for starters and both got sirloin steak for our mains.  I live steak and this is one of the best steaks I've had.  It was cooked as requested and the sides were well delivered.  Service was spot on and we felt well attended too.  Only downside was the place seemed quite full and the table next to us was so close,  it felt like we were intruding on their dinner.  The bill was not cheap but well worth it.  I will be back again,  if I can find a suitable occasion!

WjRNTHXVwt-7IfDa05WztQ.text: Hawksmoor Seven Dials was the last Hawksmoor I needed to complete the collection, and ,when I saw the email advertising their Christmas Turkey Burger as the 3rd burger special, I knew the time had come to try it.I had arranged to meet a friend there before we headed off to see a play but of course, true to form, I was delayed at work by a last minute assignment. I was further delayed by the lack of cycle parking around the place and instead had to cross a couple more streets before bike racks finally made an appearance. Seriously Seven Dials, what's going on? If any place in London should cater to a cycle over car area, I would think it would be you! I had told her to order for me when she got there as we'd be pushed for time otherwise and this almost ended up being the burger's undoing. Hawksmoor's kitchen is pretty damn efficient and served up the food within 10 minutes of ordering. The problem was, I only arrived just under 30 minutes from the order being placed (my fault, not Hawksmoor's) but they couldn't take it back to the kitchen and keep under the heat lamps as the kitchen was too busy.So when I finally arrived and persuaded the hostess to let me go to the bar (slight issue as she was admanant you couldn't walk into the bar and sit down despite my friend having done so just 30 mins before and having saved me a seat), my burger was waiting for me. It was still warm and juicy and was quite possibly the best turkey burger I've ever had. Two breaded slices of turkey breast cooked perfectly and retaining a massive amount of moisture and flavour. The bacon was there in body but not in taste and I could have skipped it without noticing. The demi-brioche bun used by Hawksmoor was delicious as usual. My main gripe was the roast potatoes served with the burger (come on...burgers should always comes with chips - this is an option but not the default). The roast potatoes lacked flavour and were slightly undercooked so quite a let down from an otherwise great meal.Extra bonus points to the bartender who, after noticing my food was waiting for 20 minutes without me, made me an old fashioned on the house. Excellent customer service with absolutely no expectation on my part or obligation on theirs, and an instance that will always remain a bright spot in my memory of the experience. At £15, it's expensive for any burger and even more so for a turkey burger so in the value for money rating it takes a hit. Taste-wise, the burger has it going on but some failings (bacon and potatoes) hurt it. Customer service was top notch for the bar staff but a bit iffy for the hostess. So overall, I think 3 stars for you Hawksmoor Seven Dials. I've had incredible experiences at your sibling restaurants so I expect more from you.

zmlxBW4dy0gLQpE5nIQ7Bw.text: Almost as good a no-name steakhouse in a third tier city. Inept, slack, lazy service, inexpertly cooked food. If you must go to Hawksmoor, chose another branch.

z-9lyDn5Xa6HdJ_gE2cV3w.text: I am from America - I know what amazing steak tastes like.  Every single thing we ordered was the most amazing thing I've ever eaten.  ESPECIALLY the rib eye and stilton hollandaise.  Anyone rating it lower doesn't know what they are talking about.  I eat enough red meat to stop my heart!  THIS PLACE WAS DELICIOUS.

oLEYqZgUCAqD_WOxN17rbg.text: I've been going to this restaurant for quite a while now, I normally get a decent experience.This time it was fairly disappointing, the steak was overcooked and flavorless, i went for a 900g bone in rib eye... so not exactly for the cheapest option... i felt like i could have bought this piece of meat anywhere else and i could have cooked it better in my own kitchen...that's not why i decide to spend 100£ on a steak.

-Gf4Bj8x7g3Irl49hne4Aw.text: Can I give 10 stars? This is a local hidden gem of the Seven Dial area, if our hotel concierge did not recommend, we would have never found it. If you are in the area and reading this, run, don't walk here. Probably the best meal have had here. It is a high caliber, high quality no frills restaurant . The decor is defiantly English, and the food is top notch. They have a wide selection of steaks and sides. Must have the Mac and cheeses and the mushrooms. Service, the service here rivals some of the best NY places I have been to. Our server Daniel was cordial, friendly and knowledgeable of the menu, cuts of meats and wine. He spent a fair amount of time with us before and afire our meal to see if we fully enjoyed our meal. He is agree at guy, as well as the rest of the staff. And they had sticky toffee pudding to finish a great meal. Can't wait to go back.

6E3hP-T6SPFnWXeHzdW2yA.text: We went here on my birthday. I can't fault a lot on the food but I just felt the atmosphere was not as good as the branch in Manchester and Air Street, despite this to be the original branch. Unfortunately they did not bring me a candle on top of my dessert despite my husband emailed in advance to arrange it. We were also left on our own in a corner before service was given. I was a bit sad because I've always had the best experience at hawksmoor and it has been the 3rd year for birthday meal.

IbqJAVOvIRXD9bsAQDXsLA.text: Wow super delish. Never had steak like this ever ever it was really melt in your mouth and flavor packed! Got the porterhouse and the filet part was to die for!! Amazing creamed spinach and loved the toffee cake! So great will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Had my first beer here!

8abTRZDxL_TshNNpaVLESQ.text: Yee Haw , oh yeah the best steak EVER and fantastic service to boot.  Please don't hesitate  to make a reservation at Hawsmoor, you will NOT be disappointed. The service is second to none, friendly and attentive without being overbearing.  No rush to get you to your table, a relaxed have a drink at the bar approach.  The restaurant has a factory chic architecture. A place where you can be dressed to impress or casual. The cocktails were great. We had a table for 7, none of our group were squashed we all had plenty of room. As the order was taken after explaining the steak choices it became apparent the waitress knew where to place the food without asking on her return with our order, very professional.  So yes the service is spot on. I dropped my knife and I picked it up and put it back on the table, without prompting a waiter discreetly appeared and changed my knife without fuss.I ordered the Bone-in prime rib to share with my friend, OMG it was so juicy with a deep steak meat flavor I can honestly say it's the best I've ever had, seriously.  We ordered Sirloin, Rump and ribeye all were just as fantastic in size, quality, taste and deliciousness. For sides we ordered beef dripping fries, triple cooked chips, macaroni cheese and bone marrow. The beef dripping fries were devine. I wanted to try the bone marrow but I would not order again. The side sauces of bernaise sauce, anchovy hollandaise and marrow gravy again nice.So if you want the best of the best in steak go to Hawksmoor. Xoxo

czo9YFFnafxyjcFb9BOxWQ.text: Still the best piece of beef I had in London. Can't beat them triple cooked chips as well.

JJ3lC8AO7BXyOL2yBPRmwQ.text: Came here without a booking on Sunday late afternoon and was cheerfully accommodated. The restaurant is located in a spacious underground that was once a brewery. I ordered Sunday roast. It was well worth the walk and wait. The meat was delicious, especially with the house gravy on the side. It came with a giant Yorkshire pudding, a roasted half garlic, a roasted leak, sautéed carrots, crispy fried potatoes and lightly sautéed sprouts. The service was prompt and attentive. All in all, more than worth the 20£. The wine and spirit list is extensive and there is also a full bar. You should put this restaurant on your list to visit when in Central London. By the way, if you go there for Sunday roast, it's best to get there by 5 PM.

MiKpeaBt2u2W0iPSqWXlvg.text: If you're looking for a Sunday roast, go here. Full stop. The portions are MASSIVE. I can't repeat this enough. You could probably share one between two of you, although whether you want to share that yummy bone marrow sauce is debatable. The Yorkshire puddings were bigger than my hand and the roast potatoes are sheer perfection. Probably also get the triple cooked chips. You will be stuffed completely, and walking straight might become a slight problem but WHO CARES?  It's great chips, and there is nothing as heart breaking as chip-regret. The service was also awesome. I loved the waiters' Hawaiian-esque T-shirts against all that polished brass and wood. SO, go now. And then go again. It's not cheap but it's so worth it. Hawksmoor truly lives up to its reputation.

9QuWKPeFSZev_5mZCs3xVg.text: Simply one of the best places for a steak! The only problem is to find a last minute table at the time I want.

ohObwc4NjiCcJB3flgNZ4w.text: Great service. Very attractive interior. Food was varied and very good. Would recommend to all types of groups including well behaved kids. There was a big Matt burger styled after the Big Mac but great tasting. Out steaks were delicious.  The beer was excellent as well.

RNKiI8GdQAiGQ0lN8zXnyg.text: We went on NY Eve for early dinner (around 6). Of course we had to book way in advance. The place is full, and a bit noisy for me. There are different crowd in here, some couples, big group, family (with small children!) so I'm not quite sure if i can recommend this on a date night! But they sure serve nice off the grill steaks! I also loved the beef dripping fried, we ordered a 2nd one just for the heck of it!  Also experiences excellent customer service.

qlXUeFcyXZrzpgK-s4uLsg.text: Mom and I went before a show an it was PERFECT. The service was great. We both got steaks and agreed they were up there with the best we've ever had. The sides and drinks were delicious too.

fvyINa0ZnfR3jlg6c31ctA.text: everthing is perfect for the night！For the starter Ihad grilled scallops，really great，the best I've ever had！Rib eye were great too！best food and best service！

bhyedb7PbmQT6lqKIGYqnA.text: Wasn't sure what to expect when walking into the restaurant and I loved the vibe, which was urban, industrial and funky.  We were immediately led to our table and our fabulous server came over to explain the whole concept, including the larger steaks written up on the chalk board.  Some might worry that this a place that could be full of suits or a bit 'fancy smancy', but it's not.  The waiters and waitresses are dressed casually and are super friendly and fun. Then came the food.  Oh, the food.  I started with the belly ribs.  I could have eaten them all night.  So utterly lush, melting in your mouth, barbecue goodness. Seriously, heaven on earth.  My husband went with the crab on toast and he thought the flavours were divine.  Portion sizes were perfect, taking off the edge of hunger, but not enough to fill you up.  We then decided to share a steak and choose a t-bone from the board.  Perfectly smokey, medium rare as ordered and gorgeously marbled.  One of the best steaks I've had in London.  We couldn't quite finish the steak, but came close.This is a wonderful treat, made even better by the service and atmosphere.  I'll be back!

iQ7HNsqqloV_9m9GtOB04Q.text: First time there and i jave to say that i was blown away with the amazing service! The staff is knowledgeable and very competent. I ordered the 3 course lunch at 27£ with a beetroot salad (not that good) the Kimchi burger with the beef dripping fries as sides (excellent! But very filling so impossible to finish) and finally the peanut butter shortbread with salted caramel ice cream that was AMAZING! Really loved the place nested in Seven dials area on a basement of an old converted storage place.Very tastefully decorated!I really recommend this place!

qb2HjYhHB_5-pjaCTG06VQ.text: Pre-theater menu £25-28 available mon-sat. Steak excellent, tender lean and nicely crusted. Triple cooked chips are amazingly crispy outside and nicely textures inside, best in London!
