Qn3t1E7FYJe-MWfRLcpc3Q.text: I've been giving out a lot of 5 stars lately, and I almost wish I could take a few back from other reviews to REALLY MAKE THIS ONE STAND OUT.Because Hawksmoor Seven Dials? Truly a stand-out experience. UnmiSTEAKably (see? Eh? Bad joke? Don't leave! Keep reading!).So, we had some celebrating to do, and also my adorable Mom is concerned about my iron levels (both true stories). Celebrating with steak, then? NAILED IT. Hawksmoor has several locations around London, but I'm a fan of Seven Dials tucked away from Covent Garden. It's a little tricky to find, but a cavernous space...it's just underground. Effect: it's a time vacuum. A literal time vacuum. You're down in a basement of a steakhouse surrounded by beautiful banquettes and dark lighting and it could be 7pm. Or 1am. Or 2016. Or 2027. Sometimes meaty time-travel is a treat, yeah?So I'm going to chirp about the Express Menu which is a great deal. It's offered at all locations, though sometimes the menu varies *slightly*, as does the time during which it's available (generally: lunch, and the either pre-dinner or post-dinner rush). For 25GBP it's 2 courses; 28GBP for three.My go-to for the starter is bone marrow. Hawksmoor does this expertly; two Fred Flintstone-style bones presented topped with caramelized onions and sprinklings of salt. Some grilled bread on the side makes it a perfect opening for, well...as Rob H. describes...the meat sweats.Rump and fillet tail are both on the Express Menu (the latter with a 5GBP supplement), which comes with a choice of side. I can confess: I've never deviated from triple cooked chips. I mean, *you* can, but I'm not gonna.I am obsessed with the anchovy hollandaise and their house-made ketchup. If you're a fan of condiments you will like this spot (hot English mustard also available). UMAMI LIKE WHOAH.I should have led with this earlier, but the boozy selection at Hawksmoor is not an afterthought. Fine selection of wines, and great cocktail list. The marmalade cocktail is citrusy and bitter but also sweet and - sole complaint - too small! Classics like negronis and whiskey sours are done perfectly. And the icing on the steak (gah; flawed visual?) is: the service at Hawksmoor. It reminds me of the best of American service, which I hope is taken as a compliment in the spirit in which it was intended: unpretentious, attentive, not overbearing. Never, ever rushed. Everyone is warm, and smiley, and open. An umbrella is remembered. A celebratory drink is comped. It's these little things that are BIG things and keep me a devoted Hawksmoor fan. Yelp note: yes, a steakhouse, but I appreciate their efforts to diversify with some vegetarian options - a fresh burrata and asparagus salad! Ricotta dumplings! - as well as some seafood and grilled chicken options. I can't promise I will try any of those offerings when I find myself in a Hawksmoor, but it's nice to know they exist. Viva la difference! (see also: MORE STEAK FOR ME)

ZTut-rz0_NKlNPueREra4g.text: I have to give this place a 5!  The ambiance &a food are amazing. It kind of feels like a modern Kings banquet dinner. This is a place to come with a big group. Amazing is all I can say.

KQ8CCQuhZYAQ3YyOIQ-pWA.text: Steak & lobster on my birthday!  Leo is a fantastic host, not only a great server but made sure we had a spectacular night!  It was everything.  Thanks so much for great service, wonderful food and a fantastic evening!  I tried a few steakhouses while in London and this spot was by far the absolute best.  Not only did I have a perfectly cooked steak but all the sides are amazing and the downstairs bar area and atmosphere is super cool.  Cheers!

SPLQZU9g3aCzZfyTVsDSLA.text: This is a great place for meat. After a simple starter I had a perfectly made medium rare steak, one of the better ones I've had ever. Not much to say about the food, since perfectly done meat is just that - perfectly done meat. If you like it (and I do...), nothing beats it. As for the atmosphere - it is classy enough for dinner dates (dimly lit with table candles), but casual enough to just enjoy a meal (no dress code and friendly informal service), or even only a drink in the bar area. The place is not cheap, but compared to other places which serve quality meat on this level around the world , it's actually not expensive either, but fairly priced.

QdAlzHyXC8fnrgLMU_6uJw.text: While visiting London we were told the "Sunday Roast" at the Hawksmoor was a must. I wholeheartedly agree and encourage you to go asap. Very cool venue.....staff was attentive and kind. The food was beyond amazing. Meat was accompanied with duck fat potatoes, carrots, greens, roasted garlic and shallot along with a Yorkshire pudding. Top that with bone marrow gravy and you have yourself heaven on a plate. We split the sticky toffee pudding which was beyond delicious. I wish there was a Hawksmoor in Charlotte, NC!!!!

3WkDc35qaYeIsVBzMSIVjg.text: A friend had made a reservation for a pre Show dinner at Hawksmoore and hyped the place for a week. I was told it was the best steak in England. If that's the case - English beef needs an overhaul. The Good News - great service and wonderful wine list. Great atmosphere and attentive bar staff. But nothing - and I mean nothing - can overcome the dynamic duo of bad beef and uninspired cooking. Nothing that spring from the kitchen seemed to be cooked .... imagine that .... not the scallops, the beef, not even the Yorkshires. Everything was underdone. And there is nothing that can point out just bad a cut of beef is than to have it served at a lower temperature. Ordered Medium, our steaks were bloody. Sent back - they weren't any better. At that point we just ate them to find he cut of the filet was dreadful. For the price I expected wonderful. Complaints were made. Chocolates were given. A massive bill was still delivered. I felt like a mark at a carnival. Skip it .... this place is the Emperors New Clothes. A bunch of young people and supposed foodies who think they know their cow but are more impressed to just get a table and be served a mediocre pile of uninspired blah.

tm0ys5uGcNAJKL1CVB3fpg.text: Was surprise how good the food was... forgot I came here my first trip to London and somehow accidentally ended here my second time lol

76k6EjNkt1CWbxfGjE_lWA.text: This place was very cool inside and underground longe. The food was pretty good! Drinks and wine were great we enjoyed coming here!

Ga4kMcDvXbAoRWQtRMgTGQ.text: Solid 3.5 stars, rounded up.Being an American, I would say that in general a British steak doesn't stand a fighting chance against a Yankee steak if they were to duke it out, but Hawksmoor does a decent job with what it's got.  I came here for their Sunday roast which comes with all the works - Yorkie pudding, potatoes, greens, vegetables, onion gravy.  They only offer one protein option for their Sunday roast meal and it is beef so if you prefer bird, pork or lamb roasts, you can skip Hawksmoor in favor of other places (ahem, Pig & Butcher). However, the roast beef served here is medium rare and tender.  I would just make sure to sprinkle it with some freshly ground salt & pepper at the table because it seems they may have forgotten to season it in the kitchen.

xp5HGoKHF2zS-kLtQEk0oQ.text: Ambience hip and casual. Service impeccable. Love the huge underground space. Good energy in here for food and drinks! Our steaks/lobsters and sides were all delicious. The meat was cooked at the perfect temperature medium rare and perfectly seasoned. It's official, This city of London does not over cook it meat anymore! Way to represent Hawksmoor! Their Martinis are tiny however, maybe a 3 oz drink (around 100 ml). Great place for a friends and family hang-out!

To0t7UFU2fkPPd3idipNGA.text: I went there with great expectations and unfortunately they were not met at all!! Overall the food was nice (but far from amazing). We had some Chateaubriand and frankly, the piece of meat was good but not the best i ever had. The wine was really nice, shame the waiter didn't know it had to be served at room temperature and opened before so it can "breathe" (even though we had to wait for it for 40 minutes)The worst part of the experience was, with no doubt, the waiter. No knowledge of the food and wine served there and for the price, i think he should also know where to put the cutlery on the table and how to pour wine in a glass. On the more positive note, the cocktail menu seemed a lot more attractive and thought for.

clXLAbfVW7kphG8XQDFnJg.text: The sirloin... mmmmm...mmmm...mmmMedium rare, it was perfect. Pink meat, clear juice, a bit fatty but not greasy. Gimme one right now please.We went for the Sunday roast which is what it's famous for. It does have an impressive variety (potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, veggies). However I found the sirloin much tastier than the cut from the Sunday roast. I will go for sirloin or ribeye next time for sure.The place is classy with quirky rustic features, with a big 'Beef and Liberty' sign near the entrance, nice wooden tables and leather chairs, dim lighting, brick wall, it really puts you in the mood for large quantity of meat. The service is nothing but delightful. Will recommend it to all fellow carnivores.

VF8oQofI4kf-YAl0rO2EqA.text: I took my parents here when they came to visit from NY and I was completely underwhelmed. My parents had flown in that day and were starving, so we skipped the starters and ordered our steaks. It ended up taking an hour to get our food, no apologies.As for the steak, I've had better. Much better. And it was extremely expensive for what it was. I've read so many great reviews that I felt like I was missing out on something. My boyfriend had eaten at the other location a couple of weeks before and said it was better, so maybe I'll have to give them another chance.

XJV0RDwiNjPv31jN2yc-BA.text: A lively thread on our office newsgroups, debating the best burgers in the area, suggested Hawksmoor might have the top ticket.  Even with warnings about how the sticker price might set us back, we traipsed across to Covent Garden to give this place a shot (booking for our party in advance, as also forewarned).Hidden in plain sight with only a large wooden door (built for a siege), three ladies are immediately inside, manning what seems to be a render farm dedicated to managing guests and their coats.  Down the steps into the dungeon, and the restaurant opens up into a brick arch and columned eating area that exudes class and comfort both.  Service is prompt and friendly, and our lady was happy to fill us in on any specific questions, of which we had many, even if all we were to order was five burgers fries and beer please.  Amongst our group we tried each of the three varieties, and none were disappointed.  The meat was dripping, perfectly cooked medium-rare, of the tastiest meltiest chuck and bone marrow, with a seared and charcoal-ly outer crunch.  The toppings were all equally fresh and tasty, all within an artisan bun that held up to the squirrelly insides and added texture of it's own. Amongst the fray, some kind of spicy horseradish type mayo that added kick and a little je-ne-sais quoi.The gravy drip chips were king; the triple fried had an excellent crunch, but were a little unremarkable in taste but in no way bad.. but seriously, get the gravy chips. All this served with my favorite London brew, the Meantime Pale Ale, which seems eternally sold out at my locale waitrose.. maybe Hawksmoor has first dips.  Sadly, I have yet to sample their bread and butter, by that I mean their steak, but considering how I enjoyed the burgers, it's a situation I plan to remedy in the future.  But mind the price, it ain't cheap.

eqGy3a17EM3fktbrzSwIsg.text: The bar is stunning--grand wood paneling, retro leather stools, solid wood tables and an elegant bar give the place a feeling of gravitas. There are a few quirky finishing touches that give the place a real personality and charm. For instance, they have collected loads of different, but beautiful glasses so each time you order a cocktail, part of the fun is finding out what glass it will be served in.The cocktail menu has been carefully crafted and even things that sound a bit odd are absolutely delicious. Highlights include the Manhattan for two people which is served in a bottle and comes with ice and garnish so you can create the drink to your liking. Other must tastes include the Silver Bullet which vaguely reminds me of rye bread (but don't let that put you off, it's fab) and the Concealed Weapon which has a base of Absinthe but ultimately has a complex flavour profile. If you're anything like me, you'll go with a bunch of friends and steadily work your way through the entire cocktail list. It's worth doing at Hawksmoor. And if you get stuck and can't decide what to order the head bartender is brilliant; he'll ask a few questions and then suggest something undoubtably amazing. He's also great at pairing cocktails with food so if you order dinner or even just dessert, definitely get a recommendation for the accompanying cocktails. I've been going on for ages about the booze, but the food is just as good. The triple cooked chips are a must even if you're just in for drinks. The steaks are cooked to perfection and I highly recommend the kimchi burger. You can't go wrong with this spot... so you'll probably walk out with an empty wallet.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

ZDJ8Y8tgT5gXELGolr2Zjg.text: The Sunday roast sounds like the thing to get, but unfortunately i wasn't there on a Sunday.  So what does that leave us for the rest of the week? My review is based on only one visit, and from eating the rib eye steak. I've read a few comments saying "this is the best steakhouse in London" and based on my humble New York Steakhouse learned sense of culinary judgement, i strongly disagree.  Rib eye is one of the most basic forms of steak, and is usually one of the most flavorful (read fatty). It's hard to screw up.  But I can honestly say the rib eye i consumed here was absolutely pedestrian rivaling any inexpensive family restaurant, and was certainly not competitive to any establishment of this caliber or price point.  While cooked to my liking, the temperature was too lukewarm having sat a bit too long.  The flavor was nothing spectacular and i'm sorry to say I've had better tasting meat served in business class of commercial airliners.  My steak at Hawksmoor was the most disappointing meal i had during my last visit to London, perhaps maybe because of my elevated expectations, and that's a shame because the ambiance and the rest of the menu were fun and worth another try.  I will be back, but i will not have the rib eye.  The smoked salmon appetizer was decent though again, i've certainly had much better during the same UK trip.  The side dish of creamed spinach was good, not overly salty like many places with a clean not too fatty aftertaste.  Dessert was a chocolate caramel tart with popcorn ice cream, a fun and rich dish which demonstrated what this place could do when it got things right.  So i will chalk this mediocre review to me ordering the wrong thing from the menu.  But i'd argue that at these prices, pretty much everything should be spot on.

CCzGkRG4haFkU5TLk9gk0A.text: If you like steak, and steak done right you need to come here.  I came in during a very slow hour so didn't have to wait too long and the service was adequate.  The food, really amazing how simple the food is but so incredibly amazing!  I had a hard time walking up the stairs after the meal (I was completely sober!) and will definitely be back again.  Kimchee burger sounds interesting so my next stop might be the bar.My only wish was that they would provide something tangy or acidic side for their bone marrow appetizer, then again with normal company I would've had some alcohol :)

jGFf7oUJ4oLZjm-5LoGIlA.text: The steak here is absolutely incredible, honestly the best I've eaten. The sides we had were also all delicious - especially the mac and cheese and beef dripping potatoes. We had a great wine, plus a delicious ginger beer cocktail (can't remember the name) to start too. Service is the perfect mix of laid back and attentive. Couldn't recommend it highly enough!

sL9as7B66YkD7lYbXWnHNw.text: This by far was a great find and the Sunday Roast was THE BEST! Service was impeccable, the food was wonderful and did not disappoint. Cannot wait to visit again and have the Sticky Toffee Pudding again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Sunday Roast - perfection!

TJHsjlafFIhmM-6xHjRO4w.text: I'll be honest, I've eaten here twice and it's not really lived up to the hype. The first time I put it down to the cut I chose (too lean and therefore no real flavour) and the 2nd time the meat arrived no warmer than tepid. Might try it one more time, (third times a charm) but if the steak isn't good then I'll have to stick to Goodman. I also don't like the (too) casual attire of the staff.... I know... casual is the new black but some of the things they wear... I wouldn't wear at home. Let alone in a place where I'm paying £30-40 for a steak.

7rteXEMhp2OJMBI727juwQ.text: Ambiance: cool, hip vibe, however a little claustrophobic. It was way too hot in the restaurant which made it uncomfortable.Drinks: good Martinis, once we let them know we dint want vermouth. Nice wine list.Food: smoked salmon appetizer: best salmon i've ever tasted. just melted in your mouth.  we shared a T-bone steak. It was juicy and flavorful for being on that de of the pond. The side dishes, mashed potatoes, mushrooms, and Cesar salad were average.

RMyqcNbcMwkrxaKd6sE0jw.text: Good welcome- check!Great drinks-check!Great food- check and check!Do your red blood cells a favour and go!

z63lDVWaSSZ2VV6Id2V_Yg.text: Service is great , place really nice and meet - it is simply amazing....and they know all about meet . Order some tbone with spinach, mushrooms and bone marrow and you will be in heaven.

9ToCM6rL6C22PxyJ5SCqnA.text: As you will read in all the other reviews, this place is well worth a visit, and does the best steaks in town. We used to go to Gaucho all the time, but I have to say, Hawksmoor is far better. The staff are excellent. Friendly, helpful and laid back, but you still feel like you're being spoilt. (if that makes sense). The cocktail bar is a great stop before sitting down. Champagne Charlie is one of my favourites. We've been a couple of times now, and it never disappoints. My only one wish would be that they have a 'ladies cut', as both times I've not been able to finish my portion ;-)Can't wait to go again.

bkG_AIhK6zzzV2yMI1pOZA.text: Great staff and food, everything was delightful without being at all stuffy. We both had the Sunday roast, and left absolutely stuffed. Extra points for accommodating us at the last minute after the place we had made reservations for cancelled on us (and we were, admittedly, not in good moods walking in. Amazing what kind, friendly staff will do for your mood.). We couldn't have been happier with our Easter Sunday lunch.

yGhsANbF226xqt8MfZm8JA.text: Wow! Our favorite restaurant while in London. The food and drinks are amazing and offer a fine sense of detail. The sticky toffee pudding with clotted cream is to die for! Really enjoyed our meal.

B-JQ_HATBqG0ALR1XgdwkA.text: I must be one of the few people who order the vegetarian option at Hawksmoor - but I really wanted to try their desserts, and rounded up some burger loving friends to come along. By all accounts the burgers were amazing - I managed to snaffle a few of the triple cooked chips which were excellent, although we all agreed that however hard people try to make their own ketchup, it's never quite as good as Heinz. Back to the veggie dish (for there was only one) - and I think they got their menu ideas from another meat-fest place, Hereford Road, as it was remarkably similar: a pearl barley risotto with various vegetables chucked in. Perfectly nice, although slightly underseasoned, so I asked for extra cheese to perk it up - and there were some oddly placed large chunks of beetroot sort of lurking on the side.Anyway - the puddings. I confess to being slightly disappointed that I couldn't try the apparently fabulous sticky toffee pudding as they now put rum in the sauce, and I can't have alcohol. I was very tempted by the peanut butter shortbread, as I tried a minature version earlier this year at some food awards - but I can never resist a decent summer pudding, so I went for that. It was gratifyingly large, in a lake of deep cerise juice - fresh and delicious. Meatless Monday? Not half bad, even at Hawksmoor.

eOLN5EZ57Cxg-v38xfYS4Q.text: Had a really great meal with a friend the other night.  The location is great, just about a block from the Covent Garden tube stop.  The staff upstairs to greet us were nice and friendly and found us a table even though we didn't have reservations on a Friday night.The restaurant itself is downstairs and has really great ambience.  Even though it was fairly crowded it wasn't too loud.The waiter was nice enough and gave us lots of options for steaks.  We actually ended up splitting a 850g porterhouse which was just right!  Cooked great and the sides were good too!  The creamed spinach was really, really good!  Even if you're not big on spinach--like me--this was just excellent.It was just over £100 for the two of us including a few drinks and service.  Pricey but well worth it!

MfQ75mAcFYa2tn9qSY9GMw.text: Our with friends most favorite place around Covent Garden. Great for meat lovers. Honest tasty food served by friendly stuff. Great care for quality. Politicians and Chef Ramsey were spotted dining in.

R3oZSp0fP9xitSfMCnE6VQ.text: Went for Express menu after late night shopping dash!  Was well worth the wait. We had the Chicory Pear salad, Rib eye and blackberry panna cotta.  Steak was ordered med-rare and was well seasoned, juicy and succulent. Will definitely be back for cocktails!

VdgE-65nvyiaW0zCENeQ8w.text: Came in with high expectations based on reviews and was incredibly disappointed. To start, the staff were all dressed in work-a-day clothes and looked quite shabby. The bone marrow was slathered with An herb sauce that masked the fact it was over cooked. The steak (d-rump and rib eye) was ok but not memorable. Considering this meal cost over £200 for two people I expected quite a lot, and they failed to deliver at every turn. We sat at our table for ages waiting for someone to come clear our plates and had at least 5 different wait staff members come by, and often they didn't know what the other one was doing or what we'd asked for. I would not come back and would not recommend this restaurant.

KhONDO_IOhKqVt8hR5fp0g.text: We had a group of five and had a nice dinner. The steak was delicious - very tender. You order family style - the steak and sides - so each order will come out in one dish to be passed around the table.  I personally LOVED the sweet potatoes. The bone marrow was a little underwhelming for my taste. The service was great - it's a nice place but the there is something laid back about it too. Overall we had a really nice meal, good food and service! There is a coat/bag check available at the reception.

D7OvG3jYMR10aRFa6OFE9g.text: The Peter Luger of London.  Larger steaks availability is written on chalk boards throughout the dining room.  The porterhouse is sublime!!! Try the mac & cheese too (3 types of cheese). Great, inventive cocktails at the bar too....

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. 1.1 kg porterhouse

3ea0x8rLBvOaig24J7o29g.text: went here on valentines day for a meal. It was really nice. We went on a Monday and they  did a special deal, were you could bring you're own wine and they de-cork it for £5.

eaEh9iW0KpaNskMA8x7UOg.text: Great venue and staff but did feel quite rushed (prefer the Spitalfields one). Good quality food though and service and had a good offer so made it worthwhile.

Oe_Gd9YHL2BqBA92InShLA.text: Marci is very rude! The place is a total dump. You have to go downstairs to have dinner in the dungeon. We had dinner there and it was whatever. It came highly recommended from our hotel but obviously they are on the payroll to refer guests there.

Y8WmxpCH9BTbEimdvOac4A.text: We had an amazing evening here, most notably due to the skill and wit of Raymond, the most extraordinary bartender I have ever encountered.  In addition to the many wonderful drinks on the menu, most notably the horse radish bloody mary, Raymond was willing to take our tastes and fashion delicious new cocktails for us.  His skill with the bottles is also mesmerizing.  The food we tried was also excellent, though we only had appetizers and some chocolates for desert.  A great spot for a special night out!

cxR00rBKlntX64xi93XQWw.text: I'd heard a lot of hype about Entrecote, but somehow Hawksmoor flew under my radar until now. The ambiance is great and the steaks are pretty straightforward- you just order a cut of meat and it comes with no frills, but cooked perfectly (I ordered mine rare and was very satisfied with the result). Out of the sides, my party had six of them, out of which I most enjoyed the macaroni cheese and the chips. Don't waste your time on the tomato salad or the buttered spring greens... really bland compared to the rest of the food. We also got the bone marrow, which was really just fat scraped off a bone... take that as you will. I've heard the Sunday roast here is amazing, but that you should pre-order to make sure they don't run out of what you want. The 5 pound BYO on Monday sounds great too! Or the set menu that's pre-6:30 or after 10 PM Monday through Saturday. So many ways to enjoy an awesome place!

OL_BmzXPhPp8Ow9K0sNyqA.text: Really good place, saw all the reviews on here and they didn't disappoint. Only ordered the burgers with fries but that was good enough. Didn't have a reservation and they were still able to accomadate. Highly recommend!

nY1zBhRqr93fMl6sg5A89w.text: Amazing food, good service. Delicious starters..try the spare ribs starter or the potted beef with Yorkshire pudding. The steaks are excellent..cooked to perfection. Not cheap but quality.

pB15Rl0xtAJHSFF5wkS5eQ.text: WOW!The service was so ATTENTIVE.  Inventive cocktails.  Meat was delicious and cooked to perfection.  Staff was able to advise on wine and our cut of beef.  And triple cooked chips?  Need I say more?  Just GO!  You won't be disappointed.

OMo-OWfDzHygyvyybQP5BQ.text: Exactly what I wanted it to be and I am now convinced the meat sweats do exist.There were so many debates around the quality of steak in the US vs the UK vs Argentina before we went here and I actively choose to disregard that entire debate and treat each individual steak I encounter on its own merits!Three friends and I went to the Hawksmoor on a Monday night, which was intentionally chosen because on Mondays you can bring any of your own wine and are only charged a £5 corkage fee. We started with cocktails in the bar where I realized instantly that I quite enjoyed the contrast between the classy drinks and high end menu with the more casually dressed staff and the exposed brick/piping environment.We were seated right on time where our wines had already been opened and decanted nicely and then proceeded to order an unecessary amount of food. We all loved the bone marrow and slow-cooked onion starter (I was unsure about that on name alone, but it was fantastic) and the ribs were nice as was the lentil salad in our fake attempt to get something lighter into the meal.I ordered the kimchi burger with triple-cooked chips as my main because I had never had it before and it was a really nice burger and a nice change from the usual. The chips and homemade ketchup were fantastic. I also participated in the two massive 900g steaks my three friends ordered between the two of them. The bone-in ribeye was absolutely phenomenal and worth the trip on its own. We also got sides of spinach, mushrooms, and more chips. And then for some reason felt the need to order desserts, which were fine, but the stars were the main dishes.I ate so much I wanted to explode, but it was entirely worth it and they let us sit at our table and savor our ridiculously long and large meal. Forget the debates between where in the world has the best meat, just go here and enjoy it. **Updated follow a visit to the one in Spitalfields (apparently they have MUCH more stringent standards for serving bar food in the restaurant harumph) and Air Street (lively environment, awful service)

aEmROQzw1Gp5lEHBQWtNig.text: Hawksmoor was recommended by a working companion and it has good reviews, so I was certain I couldn't go wrong, but to my utter dismay I was, wrong. Now, all of my Brittish companions, please do forgive me about talking about budget, prices, etc. I know that is not considered proper ettiquete here, but in America not that many people care about those things, and I want to express my whole experience so you get the total picture.The menu has a very deceptive express meal on the front of the restaurant and on the website for a two course including ribeye and sides for 20 pounds that had me still well within budget for two with extras to purchase. What they don't tell you is that it ends at 6:30pm, and our reservation was at seven. So after we got in and set down and heard the news, we had to scratch that one off. We both didn't really feel like getting up and walking out for the disinformation, how embarracing would that be?We ended up ordering one of the larger steaks that they recommend to share between two people. The steak (Chateaubriand) was supposed to be the premium cut, and according to the waitress was supposed to melt in your mouth, even better than their filet. It ended costing 72 pounds. Now folks, if you pay 72 pounds (equivelant to about $120) in the US for a steak, it will literally melt in your mounth. This one however I couldn't even finish. It was tough, grizzely, and had me wiping pieces of it in my napkin from my mouth because I couldn't swallow it. The flavor was as flat as a b minor.Giles Coren, you are so wrong about this being the best steak you'll ever eat. If this is the best steak I'll ever eat, red meat is off my list for good. Esquire magazine, I hope for your sake you do find a resaurant with better steak than this rubbish.The creamed spinach tasted like it came out of a can and the mashed potatoes and gravy were nothing exceptional either. I am very, very, very disappointed in this place. Our one night out after two weeks. Hawksmoor management, if you are going to charge top dollar for a steak, it better be of the highest quality, texture, and taste. You have disgraced yourselves. I have had better steak at a cheap family restaurant in the states, that cost the equivelant of about 5 pounds.Hawksmoor, please enjoy the value you stole from us tonight. We did not recieve anything even close to what we paid for. If it was possible to rate no stars I would but I have to give one star for okay atmosphere and friendly staff, like that of a real estate office, or car dealership if you will.charmed.

4vxyBGJsn7I0e57DbTtuaA.text: I would like to personally request that America borrow the grand British tradition of Sunday Roast...PUHLEASE! I mean, at least we got Lawry's, but still. I want to be able to go to a pub or resto on any hungover Sunday and grab me a fatty slice of red meat accompanied with delicious Yorkshire pudding and all the dressings...and subsequently fall into a food coma of epic proportions. Wake up late, get down on yo Sunday roast, then knock out again - perhaps this is what all Sundays should be about. Hawksmoor definitely has the best Sunday Roast of all the places I've tried in London. It was my favorite place to take my London guests. The whole roasted garlic bulb and the bone marrow gravy makes their Sunday Roast absolute perfection! They also have THE BEST sticky toffee pudding (one of my ultimate food obsessions whilst in London) A must-try! As the giant sign in the restaurant reads, "BEEF AND LIBERTY!!" couldn't have said it better myself.

9d3lXnUmfLiQN4TFFVIX1A.text: Food is OK,but not worth the price. I had rib eye and it was over cooked. More medium well than medium rare.  Bone marrow tasted pretty fatty. Not a dish you want to eat too much of. Food OK, but it should be spectacular for the price you pay.   Sticky toffee and peanut butter shortbread dessert were subpar. Be forewarned that the thing on top of the toffee is not ice cream. It is a huge scoop of butter.

VyyLtAADmGFMkilxS7keNA.text: In London, this is the gold standard for steak.  They know what you mean if you say "give me the surf and turf, and make my steak black and blue!"  That pretty much says it all right there.

rla_x-N_ZYNCZaom9ht7Vw.text: Very cool and unique restaurant.  My wife and I were looking for a steakhouse in London and came across Hawksmoor as a pre-theatre dinner option.  The staff were young, hip and very attentive.  We arrived early and started in the bar area.  The drink selection was amazing.  We were then walked to our seats into a large open-style setting with a great view of the kitchen.  We shared the 900g bone-in Prime Rib, beef dripping chips and mushrooms.  Everything was terrific.  Highly recommended.Cost:  £125 (~$200) for dinner and drinks for two

MY7JxGZr64Xo-qha7p5IyQ.text: When Hawksmoore Seven Dials opened last year, it was really a struggle just to make reservations at a decent time. I finally managed to and have been back a few times ever since. I always love a good burger and was looking forward to this one upon hearing so much about it. The first time, my friend I both ordered the Hawksmoor burger with chips at £15. This is on the bar menu and not in the normal menu. It isn't a problem to request for the bar menu as I have done so many a time. The beauty of eating with a friend is the opportunity to try more stuff and it was a perfect arrangement of her ordering the triple cooked chips and me the chips with beef drippings. I also ordered my burger with Colston Bassett Stilton cheese and my friend the Ogleshield cheese. Our orders finally arrived. Apologies for the dark photos, it really was quite dark in there. The meat was utterly delicious! Juicy and bursting with flavour, you can definitely taste the difference when you get meat from a good farm and butcher. As much as I love my cheeses and don't have a problem with blue cheeses, the xxx got a bit too much for me. Maybe I'm not such a huge cheese lover after all. But if you are, you would love this. The burger with the Ogleshield cheese was easier on the palate. Creamy and melting into the meat, it was messily good. How were the chips? Crisp, crunchy and yummy. They were both good but my favourite has to be the triple fried chips. The kimchi burger on the menu has also piqued my interest and on my next return, it was kimchi burger time. I really don't know if this will actually work. I mean, kimchi is a Korean staple and is cabbage that is pickled and spicy with texture that is soggy and crunchy at the same time. When the kimchi burger arrived, you definitely know that it is kimchi. The smell is strong and hits you straightaway. To my surprise, it actually works in a strange kind of way. It may not be my favourite burger combination but I actually like this. I do applaud Hawksmoor for offering something so different and out there.There are a lot more protein options on the menu for those who don't like burgers. I should try them too the next time, if I can tear myself away from the Hawksmoor burger that is!I think the burgers and chops combo is great value and we should have more places like this which serve high quality food.

ZStRFinmy6XmsGu6HZtHmw.text: Atmosphere, service, and food are all really great here. The room is decorated superbly and the waiters are extremely helpful. The steak that I received (bone-in Sirloin ) was incredible and well-seasoned. I very much recommend this location of this restaurant.

T7O4btYnBinaytmEEApXZg.text: Ok, food is amazing. Would love to leave it at that but must elaborate. Lobster, amazing. Perfect starter, left me wanting more. Waited patiently with husband for steak, he had 400g rib eye, I had 300g fillet. Paul selected anchovie-hollandaise; I chose the Bernaise. The anchovie sauce was delic (the Bernaise delicious also but variety...it is the spice of life). Triple cooked fries, em yes please. Buttered greens, I still don't know what the greens were, husband also "no idea", but they were green and crunchy, and delicious. My steak, requested medium; it arrived medium-rare. It was fabulous. I will ask for medium rare in the future. This chef knows what his doing. Go here. Eat here. Be satisfied.

Fp-t39HwdYQP0wTa0zPpsA.text: I'd been excited about our reservation at this new Hawksmoor for some time, and it didn't disappoint.Not the friendliest of welcomes on our arrival - seeing noone behind the desk I assumed they were downstairs seating customers and we waited for their return. I then managed to completely ignore the host's welcome and initial questions as I had no idea she was a member of staff in this slightly busy reception area. In fact, my only gripe about the place is that you can't tell who works here and who doesn't! The staff seemingly wear what they like and in a busy place like this, working out who is your waiter and who is just popping to the toilets isn't the easiest of tasks. Not a big gripe though.We were seated in the large dining room. The wood and metal theme lends the place a sense of industrial luxury. The table and the chairs were impressive and very comfortable.Apart from maybe 3 cuts on the menu, their steaks come in large sizes; designed to share. Not what I'm used to, but it made for a more social and interesting dining experience. I shared the 1Kg Porterhouse with a friend and it ws fantastic. Cooked to perfection with a chargrill taste on the outside and the meat so very tender and juicy inside. Perfect. The sides we opted for were frankly delicious. We can certainly vouch for the mushrooms, creamed spinach and much heralded triple-cooked chips. Great wine list here - the Pinot Noir we opted for was great.I'm glad we came here - it was more casual than Gaucho's but trendy and opulent enough to make it a special occasion.

XbiJuKgn_231q-AbL4hxuQ.text: I used to work right near the one in Spitalfields and was a regular so imagine my delight when the new one opened round the corner from where I now work in Covent Garden.Managed to get a table there last week with two friends.I knew to expect sumptuous steaks that would make me feel leaden in my feet for three days afterwards.What I wasn't expecting was the grand surroundings when you consider how ordinary the east london building is.The huge cellar type room is spectacular. Brick walls and lots of wood. The sort of place you can sink into and never want to venture outside again.You really feel like you're on a night out here. And that's before you've sat down.Service is friendly if a little casual. I don't want them fawning but a tad more formality might not go amiss after all it isn't cheap. But some people prefer that and I'm happy to go with it.Loud buzzy room. Simple menu. Steak steak and more steak.I had what I always have. A big old rib eye. And I finished every bit. I have to say I always order it medium. I know this is frowned upon but the steaks are big here and I find if you order medium rare a lot of the fat hasn't rendered which can be a little unpleasant. So I tucked my medium steak (not in size you understand, the table groans under the weight of the thing) away with gusto along with the perfectly done greens.We shared a peanut butter shortbread ice cream thing which was delicious even though puddings aren't really for me.Pathetic person that I am I stuck my whereabouts on gowalla (like foursquare) so I could boast on facebook. They have free wifi here and encourage use of it (not that you want to be concentrating on that over your guests obviously). I was thrilled to get a reply from the Hawksmoor themselves via twitter and we entered into a little banter. Not everyone's cup of tea clearly but it shows that these people are on the ball and putting attention into every detail.The bar outside the main dining room was a delight to lounge in.One quibble. We had a lovely bottle of Rioja and followed it up with the house red which, whilst not corked, was completely manky. Steer clear of that one. It's a false economy I warn you.Cheap it isn't but value for money it is. It's everything its sister restaurant is and a whole lot more.Top steak. Top room. Top night. I'll be back.

IPLXVEzW5tIIOGe8QqltXQ.text: OMG!  This place is the bomb!  I had walked all over London (11.2miles) and in dire need of delicious food.  We were able to get a seat right away on a Wednesday night, but it was still happening.  Love love love the atmosphere, very old english steakhouse feeling...industrial.  We both ordered some drinks: Tropical Cobbler for me!  I don't usually drink, but I was in love with it!!!  Sooooooooooooooooooooooooooo yummy and I didn't taste the alcohol at all!  I should've ordered a second!  He ordered whiskey or something.  He surely enjoyed it.We shared a 700g t-bone steak, we each got bone marrow, he ordered mac'n cheese.  Wow, just wow!  Everything was cooked to perfection!  Enjoyed every bit of steak topped with a bit of bone marrow and drizzled hollandaise sauce.  Holy moly!!!  He had ordered the peppercorn sauce and wasn't too pleased with it. Told him to try it with mine and I think he fell in love also!We enjoyed our drinks, meal, atmosphere, and company very much.  It was such a great way to end the night.  Unfortunately I'm 5600 miles away and cannot get the Tropical Cobbler within tubes reach!  Next time!

fYzJPWkwm1xZVvQTgvc-lw.text: After reading all of the reviews, I really did have high hopes for this place.  However, given that it's London, I shouldn't have held my breath when it comes to the food, especially red meat.  I must say that I was incredibly disappointed with this place and was expecting more.  My wife and I were in town for a long weekend a few months back, and decided to go here since we wanted to go to a steakhouse here at least once.  Let me tell you, I'll never make that mistake again...For our main course, we each had the filet mignon, which wasn't anything to rave about, which was sad considering this is supposed to be one of the best steakhouses in the city.  The cut of the meat was terrible and definitely not what you would get at the top steakhouses on this side of the pond.  Who knows what it was...  I couldn't even finish mine, and I normally pride myself on being a foodie and carnivore, and always finish my entire steak, and whatever my wife has left over from hers.  For our sides, we had the beef dripping fries and the creamed spinach.  The fries were mediocre at best and the creamed spinach was terrible and had no flavor.  To be quite honest, we thought our entire meal was disgusting and it felt like we poured our money down the toilet.  On the bright side, the drinks were good.For what this place costs, you're better off going elsewhere.  It's overpriced and just isn't worth it.  The red meat in the U.K. just doesn't compare to the U.S. and doesn't come close at all.  Now I know to stick with Indian and Thai food next time I'm in London...

0wq721KZiqB4p_DThdRiyw.text: This place was freaking amazing. First off, I would like to say this is definitely a special occasion restaurant. It's very expensive.I'm just gonna skip the stuff about ambiance, since I had no complaints about that- it was great. I'm just so excited to talk about the food.Ok, so we're gonna start with the bone marrow and onions. This was a great starter! It was rich from the marrow and sweet from the onion. I woulda licked the bone if people weren't watching. I wish there was more bread though, to spread my marrow on.Next I got the scallop appetizer. It was spectacular, the scallops were cooked perfectly, and seasoned with a very nice herby butter that pairs perfectly with the slightly sweet scallop. Definitely get this.Onto the sides, the roasted mushrooms were delicious. Nothing too fancy, just a perfectly roasted mushroom. Yum. The tomato salad was also very good. It was light and sweet and salty. The mint and basil tones in it were very nice. The shallot also added a hint of acidity and sweetness. The tomatoes were super juicy and I found myself taking bite after bite of this to complement my steak.Yum! Here come the mains. First we have the roasted sea bream. We got it with the full fish, not filleted. It was so flaky and soft. The herbs really perfumes this fish amazingly. You could taste the hints of rosemary with each bite. It was wonderful. Plus there was a piece of garlic that was roasted with it, that ended up being perfectly roasted for eating. I love roast garlic.Ok ok, now what you've all been waiting for. The steak. The t-bone was made at a perfect edge to edge medium rare. You could taste the beefiness in each bite, and the fat was rendered very well for an medium rare steak. You could eat every piece with minimal chewing. It was that tender. The Maldon salt applied before being served is really amazing at giving that amazing flavor to the steak. When we finished all the meat, there was still a bone left to gnaw on. And unlike with the bone marrow, I didn't care that people were watching me. I gnawed on that bone until it was clean.Point is, this place is great, and if you decide to come, consider inviting me. I'd be glad to join you, no matter how creepy you might be(if you paid).
