Ra7Wr87FeAsmH-rUKIZv3g.text: Great selection of wine with very knowledgeable staff! Minus 2 stars as I had to wait 30+ min in the bar before somebody even asks if I would like to order food, total ignore. What the point of sitting me at the bar as food service is terrible

dz0TSKoVozhUqecR6V5Ipg.text: this review is just for the Sunday Roast, but what the menu looks great and the service is fantastic so I'm sure everything else is goodthe Sunday Roast is an incredible bargain. £20 ! I asked the waitress if I needed a starter and she wisely said no, there was plenty of food and I should save room for dessert. she was right!the plate comes with a full head of roasted garlic. oh man, so yummy. it's a beef plate and the meat (prime cut I believe) was tender and lean. plus roasted veggies and a giant yorkshire pudding. I'm looking forward to returning for a non-Sunday meal

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

7DbJS73cq0tsSBAax6tCJQ.text: Amazingly good steak. Possibly the best I've ever had. Great ambience. I'm lucky that the dinner was arranged for me, because I wouldn't have just stumbled over this place. Now it will be a place I make a point of going when I'm in London.

vtrxM-6QMF9g9_8GZjKIKw.text: Fantastic British steakhouse! We had a pre theater dinner here and it was amazing!  We started with a light and refreshing beetroot salad, followed the star of the show...a juicy, delicious steak. Now here's the embarrassing part. I was so busy shoving food in my mouth, I neglected to take a photo of the rib-eye I was eating (haha). It was perfectly cooked, but to really make it sing, don't forget to order a sauce and some sides. I enjoyed the anchovy hollandaise (not so much my friend because well, you either love anchovies or you don't), but we both loved the macaroni and cheese. And for the finale, sticky toffee pudding. It had the perfect level of sweetness. I could have eaten two servings if we didn't have a curtain call to make. Definitely try this place! The food is excellent and the ambiance is chic yet has a distinct feel of world charm with the dark woods and sleek dark furniture.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Stick Toffee Pudding!!!
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Beetroot Salad
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Discreet entrance

5gXZkvEA84AXRIECSh4H_A.text: Love the place, great atmosphere, table was available right on the dot. I've had better steak at Capital Grill in NYC. Would recommend this place for sure.

raWfEjBX-XKssM2M9Su3sg.text: Excellent! Food is top quality and prepped and served to perfection. Bone-in-steak (med-rare of course) is spot in and no frills or thrills are added. It's about the premium cut of meat served at the right temperature to table. Pair with a refreshing herb salad and good wine and enjoy!!

YIpqvlhTa1eTqm4PBamrkg.text: My favourite place in london so far ! All is perfect!! Food, ambiance, service... didnt want to ever leave! The design and architecture of the place is really something to see and appreciate! The menu has maridage options and dessert wines which is pretty cool.. even the card and postcards are lovely. !

k1xeha7bhdIjuK0ep7lRFA.text: This is an incredible dining experience. Our waiter Ben made marvelous suggestions, starting with the scallops for an appetizer. They were creamy and covered in breadcrumbs and garlic butter. The Cesar Salad was anchovy salty adding a smidge of crack pepper made it perfection. The prime rib and filet were cooked perfectly at medium rare. I highly recommend dinner here to my friends or family traveling in London.

T0vkJR4iPqFYLAHSWxjI9w.text: Wow! Wonderful lunch with my wife and daughter, while we were on holiday from the colonies.Steak, salad, and sandwich all perfectly recommended, cooked, and presented.I highly recommend coming in for an up-scale lunch. Also, American men could really gets some tips on how to dress from the British.

uGRPtT5_vHg82xn1IotGRQ.text: This place was amazing! I was celebrating my 40th with my family and have to say the staff were amazing from start to finish. I would hands down recommend this place for amazing food and amazing service.

20XVsW3ReyDlRraz8jeRJA.text: Solid steakhouse in Piccadilly area of London.  Ordered the rib eye.  Cooked perfectly with good seasoning and not too much fat (I know it's a ribeye!).  Also had the Mac and cheese.  Nothing to get excited about.  Sticky toffee pudding was fanatic.Ate at the bar and had a great conversation with the bartender.  I would be back if I lived here.

D-tI393Mg2EuYOCfIokC3g.text: If you were to just rate the peppercorn sauce, thrice cooked chips and service this would be a six star joint.  I had the ribeye and that was just good but not great, it was cooked a little too long for medium and it was lean...which a ribeye shouldn't be.  That said the steak was tender and overall it was a great meal...just go for another cut and consider rare if u like your meat juicy

uwyGVZpo7xBnS9WxgHNsrg.text: We typically go for Sunday roast at Hawksmoor Air Street when in London, but decided to try Seven Dials last time we were there. The atmosphere is nice, very cozy and warm, but very loud as well. The roast is fantastic, however we thought the meat was prepared slightly better at Air Street. Location is very convenient, just near Covent Garden.

uTtzEYq1pP1U8K0BGp5fzQ.text: This place ranked high in London... ordered the ribeye, came cold to warm temp. Asked to reheat, came back with charred flavor.  Sides- mediocre - creamed spinach was fry, mushrooms overlooked, French fried cold.Nowhere beats the US on steaks, except maybe South America.Service however was excellent, Phillipe did his best to accommodate us and took the feedback as constructive not defensive.

bIA7bI63IH9angA7P0x4Fw.text: Back in May I took my first trip to Europe with some friends for my birthday. We met up with the cousins of one of my friends and they took us to Hawksmoor as they told us it was one of the top steakhouses in London if not the best. This place did not disappoint. The staff were very courteous, from the bouncer to the hostess to the bartender to our waiter. From the looks of it I think the building was originally a brewery which adds to the ambiance.  For a starter we had the bone marrow with onions the roast scallops with white port and garlic. I have never had bone marrow, growing up my mom used to always suck it out of chicken bones but it never seemed appetizing to me. I'm not sure if I'd try it the way my mom did but Hawksmoor definitely hit a home run with this dish, not sure if I should use a futbol (soccer) or cricket reference instead but I can't think of one. I'll be honest, I just tried to look it up but got confused. Back to the review. For dinner we decided to share two large cut steaks, the T-bone and the porterhouse. The best steaks I have had in some time, not to sound like an arrogant/ignorant American but I was pleasantly surprised at how good the steak were. I cannot wait for Hawksmoor NYC to open at the end of the year. For sides we had tripled cooked chips (fries), mash & gravy and creamed spinach, both equally delicious. Another notch on their belt is their dessert menu, very impressive selection for a steakhouse. We had the sticky toffee pudding with clotted cream, the peanut butter shortbread with salted caramel ice cream and a lemon sorbet.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding, Peanut butter shortbread with salted caramel ice cream, and a lemon sorbet.
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Steaks
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Bone marrow with onions.

nnfEHNUcTC6qT0Z0K9UHFg.text: Everything was so salty and original in its form. We ordered yams and what came were literally just baked yams. That threw me off a little as a little seasoning or alternations would be nice. My steak was cooked well but it was nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Yams and other stuff

YoPnS-dZStGqf01vrrhufA.text: We didn't have a reservation, but managed to score a table by the bar in between watching Harry Potter play 1 & 2.  It was barely 5:30 PM on Sunday and their Sunday Roast was almost gone!  Loved the food and loved the service; our server was awesome in giving us recommendations and the heads up about the Sunday Roast.Had some delicious beer (no drafts here), and ordered the bone marrow (amazing!), french fries (nothing extraordinary), tomato salad (super flavorful), house smoked salmon (fresh quality), grilled lobster roll (really delicious).  Overall, loved everything we ordered and would absolutely come back here again!

bTgel21vnuQx1ilJHvpMhw.text: Excellent service, good food although do not expect the crazy dosages of beef that we are used to in American steakhouses. Surprising young feel in an otherwise classic interior was very pleasant. We hosted well appreciated customers who in turn had a good time.

LiRZYVP3Qpdlqw6T1Fd_aQ.text: When 5 stars aren't even enough....!I booked this branch of Hawksmoor for a special work lunch after reading wonderful things on here and other places and was absolutely thrilled with everything about the experience and so were my colleagues. Even now looking back I can still remember how beautiful the food and drink was and what a wonderful time we had, we were all completely salivating over it! The food was stunning, we went for the three course express lunch option - we all had caeser salad to start with; steak for our main - I had the stilton sauce and it was utterly divine; and for dessert I had the toffee sundae which was delicious. Our wine, a Spanish red, was gorgeous and I would definitely recommend it and have it again as it was extremely drinkable. The service was fantastic - the staff were really friendly; knowledgeable, helpful and quick. The atmosphere was lively and buzzy and full of a variety of people, though we did keep laughing at the amount of businessmen there and we just kept saying it's because of the meat! I would definitely return here and have since recommended Hawksmoor to lots of people!

RTn_p5efsTAh5UeV9sFn0g.text: Excellent steaks made by a restaurant staff that knows their way around a grill.The decor of the place almost felt industrial, as you are dining in an underground environment that is a mix of piping and lounge. It doesn't describe well, but it works.The staff was amazing. Very laid back, helpful, and on point.Steaks were perfectly prepared, and the sides also stood out for us: a well-seasoned creamed spinach was the highlight.Strongly recommended.

oDAfNM5R2IY7mpaSgmHALA.text: Second time there. Meat is excellent and so are the sides. I had a chance to sit at the bar and watch one of their excellent bartenders perform his craft. Worth the show and personally engaging. I will definitely be back!

XCX-qQJ4H02dGlrIXiMUWA.text: This place is all about burgers at the bar for me. While I have no doubt that the restaurant proper can deliver the goods, I have never found the need to venture in.So, back to the bar. You are, seated in high seats which have a slight swivel to them which is quite fun (or is that a memory driven by too much time at the bar)!?! A bartender is immediately on hand to provide a welcome cocktail or wine from a pricey and steak focused list. Then it is onto the burgers (well, at least for me, as other options are available). These come in three varieties. The burger of the month (no really), the kimchi and the Hawksmoor (served with Ogleshield or Colston Basset Stilton). All are more than a mouthful. On the side both beef dripping chips or triple cooked chips are available. Again, all is well.Maybe one day I will venture into the restaurant and tuck into a rib eye (I have heard good things). However, the burger bar (my name) may well continue to be irresistible.

2OyMlb8tBlk42Q3-5JrC5A.text: Everyone and their neighbour seems to have been here and reviewed it by now but I'll throw mine in as well just because it was so good. I had a day between jobs and decided to go trying the kimchi burger people been raving about. In short, I can see why. I had it for lunch and am already dreaming of going back there again to have another. Even though I was utterly stuffed leaving the place. After entering the place you go downstairs and either into the restaurant for a meat fest or to the bar for the bar menu. I went for the bar as I wanted to try the burger. The place was pretty much deserted around the time (1.30 on a Monday) and the staff were quick to take my order. Overall, the service I received was excellent. I couldn't believe how quickly the served me my order, the kimchi burger with triple-cooked chips. After the first bite I instantly understood the rave reviews. Succulent burger with fresh, crunchy kimchi and smothered in cheese. Maybe not good for you but when it taste so good then who cares? In short, the burger is all people make it out to be: outstanding. Go. Eat. Now.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Kimchi Burger

nZEMRH5ylwD_UZoWmuGWIw.text: Excellent from start to finish. Arrived very early, but they allowed me to hop on their free wifi from the bar in comfort. Nothing super innovative, but excellent pork ribs to start, and a remarkably flavourful ribeye main. Our server was outstanding throughout - personable, helpful (and even helped me take away some bones for the dogs...). Will be back - it is a great room - nicely vaulted ceilings added to great ambience without it being overwhelmingly noisy.

zbGtJ60NQPoj7CmDbpByWg.text: This place was awesome. The atmosphere was great: lots of dark wood and brass, and a polite, attentive staff -- but without being obnoxiously opulent like some of the steak houses in New York (where I live).I had a porterhouse steak, medium rare.  It came much rarer than I would have expected -- almost cold in the middle.  I normally think of myself as not liking "undercooked" steak, but after eating that porterhouse I may have changed my mind.  This meat was fantastic.  I also had the "triple fried" chips and those were excellent as well.Also an excellent selection of scotches.  I asked the bartender to try to find me something I couldn't get in the US. I wound up with a Kilchoman, which is a small distillery I had never heard of before.  I'm not really sure it's impossible to find in the states, but it was rare enough (and good enough) that I was totally satisfied.I'm only in London for a week and already having to fight the urge to just eat at Hawksmoor every night.

olfqRM5J1N3v03D9VPSxaQ.text: You could give it a 4 out of 5 when you want to reserve the 5 out of 5 for the one really special experience, but when it comes to Meat - Hawksmoor is for me a 5 and I am only considering the food. Slightly upscale (meaning a lot of suits), not cheap - the burger is not on the Restaurant Menu, but on the Bar menu, just ask for it and is fabulous. When I was there, they had a monthly burger special - this is the most cost effective option for Hawksmoor anyway. Then there are the steaks, I had a 800g Prime Rib and it is just meat Nirvana. Accompanied by a Cabernet, Domaine Du Haut Bourg just perfect. When you feel your heart struggling with that combination of meat and wine, have a dessert is will certainly kill you, but with a smile on your face.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

9rhkYoLPDxMHXZ9KHs7anw.text: A good place to get proper steaks!  The food was delicious, steaks perfectly done, and service was top notch.  The ambiance was very befitting as well.  It's a fantastic place to dine and would do so again gladly.  Although I don't know that I will ever be able to order a 1kg porterhouse or chateaubriand (I doubt I could eat or pay so much in one sitting, £70+ each!).Why four stars?  My American sensibilities will not allow me to go higher because of the value per £ - it may be on-par for the UK (I have no idea, really), but back home, at the very best or fanciest steakhouses, I would get an equal or greater meal for literally half the price of Hawksmoor.  I was also surprised at how casual of a restaurant this was, considering the ambiance and price point.  Jeans seem fully acceptable attire here, for both the wait staff and clientele.  I would feel more ok with the price if, looking around at dinner, I felt that I was dining with the crème-de-la-crème of society.  But it's still a fantastic place to eat - especially if someone else is footing the bill!

g177Cr7JZ6MH6OjDrLyIgg.text: I dropped by on a whim for lunch largely because I had a massive craving for some steak. My friend and I were in a slight rush, so we were glad to see to hear that there was an "express menu" option. I opted for the rib-eye steak and my friend went for the roast chicken, whilst we shared a goat's curd spring salad. We waited 15-20 minutes for the salad to arrive, and we weren't impressed. The salad was very clunky...the goat's curd completely overpowered it. Afterwards, it took another half hour for our mains to arrive. I can sympathise with lengthy waits between courses if the kitchen is swamped - but the dining room was barely half full. I can't fault the quality of meat here though. My rib-eye was perfectly cooked (medium rare as ordered), and tasted incredible. A minor criticism, but there were a few times when I could taste flakes of sea salt. My friend's chicken was nice, but nothing outstanding.Service was slow, but fine. All in all, great steak, but I was let down by the long wait times and average service.

vq5btcmCrwJCyjrJHvIQTg.text: I've been following Will @Hawksmoor on Twitter for a while. The photos, sorry, 'food porn' was too much. I had to go. I went along to a Qype event pre-launch. In fact, they open the doors to the public today. The friendly, knowledgeable drink mixologist behind the bar showed us the cocktail ingredients of yesteryear such as benedictine and herbal infusions displayed in antique glassware as he prepared a drinke of olde. I later found out the guy was 'Shakey Pete', apparently one of the greatest barmen this century (who dresses like he's from the beginning of the last century). My inquisitiveness and interest in the apothecary type display of ingredients was rewarded with Pete spraying an odd looking cigar infusion alcohol onto a paper napkin. I naturally sniffed the soaked napkin, looking like a scene in a film noir before things go terribly wrong. However, it was a bizzarre aroma that was surprisingly pleasant and an example of the ingredient uniqueness of the drinks on offer that are certainly not boring. I later sipped some of the Zombie cocktail that had a absinthe flame burning a top of the large sundae style glass. It was delicious. Over to the food, this place is about meat. The sight of the bone marrow was way over exciting, even after recently enjoying the same dish at St John Restaurant. However the 'half-pipe' sliced bones mant far easier scooping out than the tubular bones. I had a chance to try the lamb cutlets that were so good I had a cheeky second one just to check my taste buds weren't tricking me. I spotted what looked like crayfish on brioche and politely passed the offer. I later found out this was a £20 warm lobster roll which was apparently delicious. Fail. I also tried the kimchi burger in which the pickled-fermented-Korean vegetable resembled shredded carrot. In fact, me and fellow Qyper Bring_Stuff decided this tasted like a shepherd's pie burger, however, this may have been down to the deceptive kimchi looking carrot-like. Either way it was fine. I also realised the other burger they do contains nuggets of bone marrow. Yes, I am obsessed. This place is eclectic, eccentric and extravagant. The drinks are amazing and the food is incredible. It's not cheap, but it is special. I'll be back for some of that bone marrow burger and to actually confirm the legend status of their steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

jL9UYNC99T_qfgRFNmW4ig.text: I love this place. It took me a while to 'get it' and to ease into the venue, but I was flitting between two tables of happy Qypers trying to catch up with everyone. Not an easy feat. AND whilst I was doing that, Qypers were all stealing the yummy food! Surely there's a rule that means the hostess gets fed first? No? Oh fine then. Of the food I did manage to nab from the greedy hands of Qypers, I'd do very very bad things for those lamb cutlets. Unspeakably so. They were possibly the best lamb cutlets I've ever had. Don't taste like that when I cook 'em. I also tried some fantastic lobster. Mmmmm, lobster. And whilst everyone else was dousing their oysters in tabasco (even Hawkmoor can't convince me to try another oyster in my lifetime), I decided to work my way through their cocktail menu and prop up the bar. I tried a Hawksmoor Julep, which was basically a historical forest in a glass (love that they've gone back in time with their classics). Mint, and all sorts of yummy things (despite us not being able to recognise thyme, and thinking it was heather, and also sage, and rosemary, we're not very clever). And there were zombies to be drunk (between four) and interesting things on the bar like tobacco bitters and tiny little decanters of Benedictine. And then, I finally understood the venue. It's a flip around of the Shoreditch venue (if you've been, you can't help but compare the two). So this one has more focus on the bar, and the cocktails. That's not to say they don't to their famed steaks though, just poke your head into the cavernous dining room, try not to stare when you see the ceilings. This is everything Hawksmoor is and better. Their five stars is cemented by their red wine and their charming bar staff. I have no idea what red I was drinking, but it was fantastically easy to drink. I didn't get home until 1am. Everyone around my table seemed to be sipping it whilst I wasn't looking. Pesky buggers. But I'll come back just for the wine. And then I'll maybe have a cocktail, and ooooh some beef dripping chips (which were gone by the time we got hungry again) and some cutlets and oooh would you lookit that, I'm drunk and I've gone through the entire bar menu. Sneaky genius, right there. I can't wait. Book ahead, won't you? There's no way this place won't be packed out every night. (Thanks to Will and Hawksmoor for hosting such a lovely event for Qype, some of our food and drink was complimentary.)

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

QtC2FZTyfwx6UL2KaO4L4g.text: Was brought here by my boyfriend for my birthday and it did not disappoint! Exceptional service, the food was AMAZING! A little pricy, but worth every penny! Go hungry and make sure you try the cocktails. will defiantly be returning.

3u_j-lnc49kfuTBRybyI2A.text: If you're a fan of beef, then this is certainly the place for you. Great food, attentive service and a good selection of drinks. They even have a wine club, where you can take your own bottle and only be charged a minimal £5 corkage charge. Breakfast at the Guildhall branch is the ultimate breakfast of champions and eraser of hangovers!

CK3C8K_JrDrnvN1V41gaOA.text: As always the Hawsmoor never lets me down.I love this family of restaurants, they do everything right, and make you feel special while they are doing it. Which you really can't ask for much more.Its the perfect place to have either lunch or dinner, although I would suggest that if you have a busy afternoon ahead, perhaps save the trip here for another day, because eating half a cow could leave you a little lethargic.Previously having been here in the past, it was a logical choice for my meeting with a rugby player, and needless to say it went down well. Sadly as he had another meeting afterward he was unable to sample the wonder Juniper cocktails (all of which I have sampled), which was a shame as he is a gin fan. Not to worry, what a great excuse to go back again. ;o)

RZv3RZc41fIelh_aiU3tXQ.text: While staying in London I wanted to find a steak house on the higher end and the Hawksmoor did not disappoint.  It was a last minute visit so there were no reservations left when we walked in but we were able to eat the full menu at the bar which was not a problem at all.  Their craft cocktail list was really cool and was not all fluff.  What I mean by that is that the drinks didn't just sound/look good they actually tasted good.  The bartender was professional and patient with us Americans since we had a few questions on the menu.  The steaks were undercooked from how we requested them but I chalk that up to the difference in culture.  They were more than happy to refire them for us.  The restaurants setting was unique as it was underground which gave it an interesting vibe.  Given the chance I would recommend coming here and I would personally visit again.

Cv9bJ4mkQR9OnBAj6sH83Q.text: Dined in this branch of Hawksmoor on the London Burger challenge - it was placed at number 5. The service was a bit slow and muddled however the burgers were well cooked and seasoned but nothing spectacular. The steaks are FAR better if you have a little extra cash to splash. Burgers came with fries and served medium. I would not suggest it as a go to burger spot but rave about there main menu.

QL7_S2H_qXdjhhgehzvIVw.text: Got vouchers for Christmas because I'd been wanting to try this place out for ages. Got a Porterhouse to share AND a side of Lobster because it was one of those nights. The food is amazing, best steak ever and worth the price. The only thing that let it down was the waiter. He went through the paces of taking our order but wasn't friendly at all. I love steak so was asking all about the cuts and he just didn't really want to engage. However I didn't come here for him, I came for the food and I left full of delicious steak.

qGMzp9Yrz_zI6C462s6QYw.text: Mad Men era (the earlier series) is the best description I think you can get for the Covent Garden Hawksmoor, as has been mentioned by others. The place has a great feel to it. Qypers were treated to the bar snack menu. The dishes were devoured leaving everyone wanting more, which is as good a recommendation as you can get. The lamb cutlets really were "melt in the mouth" tender! Prices in the bar area were expensive, and I'm sure the dining room would be correspondingly priced but it would be worth it for such a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

z21IfqMoeBUjsSF1m4KmAw.text: 4.5 StarsExcellent meat, the rib eye I had was flavorful throughout, each bite was quality and easily chewable. No part was tough or dry. Though I ordered peppercorn sauce on the side, it was pretty much unnecessary and didn't add to the meal. The peppercorn sauce was a smooth cream sauce that actually didn't have much of a peppercorn taste. (I would have liked it more peppery.)The sticky toffee pudding was a tad too sweet but clotted cream on the side really helped balance out the dessert. In fact, I liked the clotted cream the most.Friendly service though 12.5% tip is automatically added on the bill.

W-eYeVVD3EqCxR1ZZ0R0WQ.text: I was on a mission to find the best steak in town.  Called 2 hours in advance and they said that i can have the table near the bar which I am fine with as I was there alone.  There are 2 separate sections.  The main dining area and the bar area which can also serve food.  This place has a very rustic look.Tartare for starter - Extremely flavourful and caper did not overpower.  Just the right sweet, saltiness and tanginess with the steak.Ribeye steak for main - Burnt flavour was strong. Cut I thought maybe a bit too thick.  Certain parts was a bit harder to chew and some parts were tough.  I think it lingered in my mouth for a bit slightly longer than I would like before I had to swallow.Tried The Guinea in Mayfair and thought the ribeye there is cooked slightly better compared to Hawksmoor.  Controversial.  Mission Continues..

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

_hwK-EKHE0HnOpQpn5iB2A.text: Not A SteakHouse ! I Have Eaten To Thousand Of  Steak Houses And This Is Probably The Must Sorry Excuse For One That There Ever Was !There Meat Is Like Smashed Hamburger Shaped Into Steak ....I Feel Bad For People Who Think This Is a Steakhouse Let Alone Food All In All: If Your Looking For Steak Try Something Else Because This Place Is Not It !

M_ovjQ-h-IGJq8HQpB4hig.text: Best Steak house and possibly restaurant in the UK.  Service top notch and food amazing (along with the cocktails).

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom

ipUxVv06pJfeLC8iKzUGBg.text: I've never meant "as good as it gets" as I do for this establishment.  So much so, that I didn't mind being seated where I was exposed to the outside smoke seeping in when patrons entered and exited the restaurant.Prologue: I tried making a last minute reservation with this restaurant for a large party after it was recommended by a variety of friends.  Though they didn't have space for us, I kept contacting them in the hopes that someone would cancel their reservation.  They worked with me to accommodate my party in the bar where we had a marvelous experience.The disappointment of the night:  We had the scallops as a starter and though the scallop itself was cooked perfectly, there was some kind of breadcrumb that was akin to sand placed on top which ruined the taste and feel of the scallop.  But even this rocky start didn't ruin the meal...My husband and I shared an 800g porterhouse.  Though the cook and seasoning were perfect, we could've used a larger steak, it was that good!  Very tender and had a well-rounded, meatiness to it that some steakhouses can't nail.  The fries/chips were crunchy with soft interiors and the purple broccoli was tender on the outside with a bite in the middle.The sticky toffee pudding with clotted cream was unreasonably good.  I came very close to making all kinds of happy noises at the table.  I had a bite of my mother-in-law's and decided right then and there that I needed one of my own, which I pretty much devoured.  I came very close to ordering another.Although I only review service if it was excessively awful, in this case I must review our server Tom for being very courteous, attentive, and knowledgeable.It was a night I won't easily forget and one I wish to repeat the next time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Porterhouse!

Cpb1HYxo3upnJkLCpNzOYA.text: Came here for my first Sunday roast and I must say that I was not disappointed. Came sans reservation but we were immediately sat at a bar. The atmosphere had a high end pub feel to it which was different and a nice change of pace. Given that it was 12:30pm and we had just woken up, we decided to only go with one Sunday roast to share with some sides. Ended up going with the sourdough bread and butter to start the meal off. I found the butter to have a nice texture and the bread to be good, but nothing spectacular. I ended up getting a August Town pale ale which is made exclusively for the restaurant but unfortunately didn't come from a tap. There ended up being a small piece of glass on the underside of my mug and the server graciously offered me another beer which I happily accepted. The roast itself, whole nothing truly ground breaking in terms of technique, truly felt like such a cohesive meal. While the meat could be from a better cut, it was cooked a perfect medium rare and had great char. The horseradish was mild but tasty. The additional clove of garlic and head of grilled shallot was a nice touch and the cooked carrots and greens complemented the meal perfectly. The potatoes were crispy and inherently dry but when paired with the gravy, it made for a great combination. We also added a side of mac cheese which went very well with the rest of the dish. We ended the meal with our first sticky toffee pudding which was to die for! Top 10 desserts I've ever had, no doubt.This place is worth coming to but yet your reservations in ahead of time!

_g-KzPFo1u2CbViQpdmXpA.text: Probably top 10 steakhouses. Definitely wins in the cocktail department.I ordered the sirloin and they cooked it perfectly. The bone marrow sauce was excellent.The beef fat cooked fries were also excellent.

aDBEcEIF6ZYGzqMibQ5fpA.text: The Express Menu meal was great, salads, steaks & chips, cooked just right, and dessert!  But the star of the event was the cocktail - so good we had to come back a second time, for the Full-Fat Old Fashioned - butter-infused - yummy!

RmbyNH_H0ifd0iXBth_FkQ.text: Return visit. Enjoyed caesar salads; loved mine because asked for extra anchovies and was presented a salad deliciously loaded with them. Shared a large cut of prime rib. Arranged in thick slices off the bone. Really tasty meal with triple cooked chips. Hard pressed not to return each time we're in London.

EZrzQbfhhLqq-L7jE11Nfg.text: Heard of this place is very famous of their steaks. Made reservation 2 weeks in advance before I arrived London. The restaurant is located in the middle of the city. They offered me to hang my coat at the reception area (this might be the culture in Europe)! The host took me downstairs, and it is a combination of a bar and dine in restaurant! Ordered bone marrow, spice-roast cauliflower, rib eye, and lobster. I like the way they prepare their steak as it would not be too salty! Also, portion was just right, and I did not feel I overate! However, I was a bit disappointed for the lobster. It was over-cooked, and the texture was rough. The other downside was that space is very limited, and I felt a bit cramping. Overall, great experience, and I will come back for their steaks!

5x1XWIBEz44mtU7O-AugHg.text: We came here for dinner on our first day in London and were very happy with our dining experience. For openers, the waiter recommended the Shaky Pete's Ginger Brew (cocktail) which was superb, especially on a 90+ degree day.  Next, we came here primarily for the Sunday Roast which my son and I each ordered.  We were not disappointed. My wife ordered the lobster with garlic butter, and my daughter (who was not hungry) ordered the scallops.The Sunday Roast was fantastic!  It came with Yorkshire pudding and roasted vegetables (see photo) and was everything we expected from having seen TV shows showing Sunday Roast!  The lobster was also good. Cooked perfectly.  The scallops were not what we expected, however.  They were mixed with bread crumbs and some other ingredients that we couldn't really discern and we left them unfinished.  That may just be our taste buds because I saw others with the scallops and they seemed to enjoy them. I didn't take a photo of them but others reviewing this restaurant have, so I highly recommend checking out those photos beforehand. (There was no cell phone coverage in the main eating area so I couldn't follow my own advice!)

photos.caption: Photo of Hawksmoor Seven Dials - London, United Kingdom. Sunday Roast

ShAp-wVK4zS3KeJtVth8WQ.text: Was extra stuffed after dinner and for good reason! Visiting from Canada and found this place on Yelp nearby as we were looking for a nice steak dinner. Being from Alberta where we have excellent highly graded beef, sometimes my tastebuds for beef are disappointed when I travel. But this place: Delicious! Everything was and we ordered a lot. Sirloins were perfect, beef dripping fries, buttered English greens, roasted mushrooms, grilled bone marrow, bernaise sauce, all yummy. You can tell that everything prepared is with quality ingredients and care in cooking. Love this place. Fantastic service and good cocktails too. Atmosphere is not pretentious. Highly recommend.

uNSM6h4KVI9EluWb9XKRXg.text: Well...I have never been compelled to leave a poor review before but I must say: incredibly average diner and the service was actually exactly like one reviewer said., and I read .., before coming here. Tasteless food and tasteless service...I travel the globe and love people ...truly...which is why I enjoy my job...the service made me feel like I was in their way and I was truly trying to connect with the servers.On the bright side...London is amazing, the people are incredibly warm and witty...the sites  are fantastic...so much so that this place (yep.., I am still sitting here!) could not tarnish the trip...But this dinner experience was awful. As far as I can tell.., The app won't let me close out until I chose at least one star ...that's the only reason it gets one star.This is REALLY uncharacteristic of me...but I feel compelled to be honest.

s1TDx7wsk5gV1q_Q-jowCA.text: Ed our waiter was incredible! Not only did he give us incredible dinner choices he gave us other great places to go eat while on holiday in London! Hawksmoor has incredible food and the steak was cooked perfectly, the ambiance great but Ed truly makes you feel welcomed at this restaurant. I will highly recommend this restaurant for the hospitality of Ed and a great steak.

UM-xqfrxvD5plPAPYJdtSQ.text: Sunday roast is good, it comes with steak, vegie and pudding.  So, it is best to come here on Sunday.  The atmosphere here is really great, also it is located at  Covent Garden.

2GQZVLsVCK5EbUMOgrQFbA.text: Oh my word!!!   Best sticky toffee pudding in the entire  all of London!!!  Stopped in and had it several times this week.  Slightly better first over Bricklayer Arms in Flauden

TC0ffZZqqSxF_V8XaaXP6Q.text: Overall very good but my filet was sadly served completely rare and cold after I asked for it to be cooked medium -well one.

dY-PsbEH9wA3KpuWCtt50A.text: That steak. That creamed spinach. That buttered asparagus. To die for. Whatever you do... go... drop everything now and GO.

8vPHFmGVp7LngmIoVLhg5g.text: I had barely slept during the flight over from the US, and after landing at 7 AM and working a full day in the office, I was ready to sit inside my hotel room and order room service.  But then I thought to myself: "NO!  I'm in London!"  I couldn't let something trivial like jet lag stop me from exploring the culinary wonders of the city!Like any good Yelper, I had done my homework beforehand and had Hawksmoor on my shortlist of places to try based on recommendations from local Yelpers and other coworkers, so I laced up my shoes and made the short trek over to Covent Garden to check it out.Thankfully, there was no wait on a Monday night - I showed up and was seated immediately even without prior reservations.  After checking out their offerings, I ended up ordering from their "Express Menu," which is where you can order a starter, an entrée, and a dessert as a prix-fixe deal.For my starter, I ordered their Bone Marrow and WOW was this superb!  Two huge bones dripping in rendered fat and marrow, liberally covered in caramelized onions and featuring two hefty chunks of bread on the side to mop it all up.  I devoured everything; the sweetness of the onions perfectly complemented the saltiness and richness of the marrow.  Honestly, the starter was filling enough on its own, but then my main entrée arrived - 200g of beef fillet with a side of peppercorn sauce and a dish of buttered English greens.  The fillet was cooked perfectly as I requested (rare) and quite tender, although I would have like a better sear on the outside.  The peppercorn sauce was a bit of a letdown unfortunately... on the watery side and not "peppery" at all.For dessert, I wanted to try a "classic" British option, so I chose the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and this was AMAZING.  The pudding itself was the perfect consistency, absorbing all the lovely caramel sauce without getting too spongy or soggy.  It came topped with a light custard that just perfectly balanced all the heavy richness of the pudding and sauce.  Now I'm wishing more restaurants in the States offered this as a dessert option!OVERALL: 4/5.  The beef fillet was very good, but just a little under what I was expecting for such a highly rated steakhouse.  On the other hand, the bone marrow starter and sticky toffee pudding dessert were both total 5/5s.  Glad I was able to eat here during my trip!

B9vz_JvYpUU9JhZZNwvEiA.text: Went for lunch and had the express menu (lunch menu). Rump steak was perfectly cooked. Service was very attentive. I would definitely return.

BhGV3tPpqaTxTMSiFp-2mA.text: I went to dinner at Hawksmoor Seven Dials on Friday night and it was quite good although not the "blow your mind" experience that I feel it should be for the price. For a starter, I got the crab on toast and it was "eh"...nothing too special.  For my main, I got the 400gram Prime rib which was amazing.   The stilton hollandaise sauce was the perfect addition to this juicy steak!  My main beef (pun intended) with Hawksmoor Seven Dials...was the "blah" sides that could be selected to go with our meat.  I love when going to Goodman Steak (a competitor I would assume)...that I can get amazing wow factor compliments like Beer Dripping Chips, Creamed Spinach with Gruyere Cheese or Truffle Mac - n- cheese.  Hawksmoor on the other hand offers a more bland accompaniment like just plain ole mac - n- cheese, creamed spinach, tripple cooked chips.  They were all okay but there was no conversation piece like I feel like you should have if you are spending over a hundred pounds for a meal.If I need a steakhouse to take people for a special experience,  I think I would choose somewhere else given the lacking wow menu.  If it's on your radar and you want to try Hawksmoor...  definitely go as the food is good, the staff is great and you won't be let down from an overall point of view.

wsTVP3zpiTxDlhmMwXVAhQ.text: If good quality, we'll cooked steaks are your thing, Hawksmoor does not fail to please.Even with a large party the service was quick and helpful and the meat perfectly cooked.Definitely worth a visit.

l0QUpAC5JRlk1G-wU_Bskw.text: I came here with my girlfriend for dinner before our musical. I have heard great things about Hawksmoor and was very excited about finally trying out the 'best steak in London'. The location is a bit awkward, hidden away from the main streets, which led to a bit of tardiness on our part arriving 15 minutes late for our reservation. However, upon arriving, the friendly receptionist quickly guided us to our seats. Our seats were fantastic, right in the centre of the restaurant. Each table was decorated with a candle, that combined with the dim lighting of the restaurant gave it a great ambiance for the romantic date I wanted. The waiters were all extremely polite and friendly, but the place was busy despite our decision to dine before 6 so a lady, who I assume a manager of sorts, had to step in and take our orders. The food came swiftly after our order. I ordered the bone marrow with onions for my first course, and my girlfriend got the potted mackerel. The bone marrow, served as two gigantic bones cut in half and stuffed with marrow and caramelised onion, was absolutely sublime . However, the bread that came along with the dish was a bit burnt. The mackerel was also quite delicious, coming in a small jar with jelly and garlic bread. My girlfriend did say half way through the pot that it tasted very much like tuna, just very high end tuna. Overall, very satisfied with the flavour and overall presentation of our appetisers. Both my girlfriend and I ordered the ribeye for our main. My girlfriend, who seldom eats steak, absolutely loved hers and said that she is definitely thinking of ordering steak in the future. I have very high standards for my steaks, and I often cook my own. That is why I was slightly disappointed by the medium rare ribeye that was still red in the middle. The steak was seasoned simply, just salt and pepper as I do at home, but the charred mark made the steak untastefully bitter at times. Our sides of fries and sweet potatoes were wonderfully done. I am worried that the steaks they served on the express menu were not of the same quality they serve if you simply ordered it a la carte. We ran out of time, or else would have definitely like to try one of their deserts. Overall, great starter, average steak. I would appreciate a bit more care on their part to not have burnt my bread. However, I would still like to come back and give their steaks another try.

pmQXai_9C_tvapkp4TIKdA.text: We went to Hawksmoor Seven Dials on a cold raining day in London.  It was at 4 pm, when many restaurants in London are closed.  With a baby (she was running around the place, it was so big and so loud, nobody minded), a vegetarian (she adored the Salt-Baked Beetroot with Hazelnuts & Horseradish and the Creamed Spinach), a beer drinker (he had a larger from the Meantime Brewery  in Greenwich),  a carnivore  (he had Grilled Bone Marrow and Fillet) and a sea food lover (he had Native Lobster Grilled with Garlic Butter) we were all thoroughly pleased and satisfied.   The service was great and the atmosphere was jolly and toasty.

Ud6meAipTFZSZwJ_pc6LqA.text: I'd give them six stars if I could.THE best place to get a steak in London and easily my favourite restaurant.Here's why: They serve amazing food in a cool setting and have managed not to get full of themselves in the midst of all this fabulousness.  It's good value. You will probably spend lots of money but you'll get lots for it and you'll have the best quality out there. The steaks are perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked and stand perfectly on their own. The sides are darn tasty, too. The service and vibe you get from the staff is smart, helpful, friendly and slightly (but not too) hip. The wine list. Lots of great options even if you don't have tons to spend.

sf701x2LlPrrQZAECdaDBg.text: I am torn about how to rate Hawksmoor Seven Dials. On the one hand, food itself, the cocktail program and the setting merit 5 stars, but problems with wine service service and our experience with the sommelier are closer to 1 or 2 stars.My husband and I chose this steakhouse to celebrate his birthday and our moving to London. After a crazy day of unpacking boxes and assembling furniture, we were ready for some steak! The experience started off beautifully - the old subterranean brewery feels wonderfully atmospheric and the cocktail list has something for everyone - I started off with the Bloody Mary Number 7, with horseradish-infused gin and a splash of porter. Even my husband liked it and he does not normally like bloody marys. I can't remember which cocktail he had, but we both liked it, and the rest of the list looked great.I have no complaints about the food itself. We started off with Brixham crab on toast and Caesar salad - both simple but delicious - and for mains, I had ribeye and my husband had one of the massive bone-in cuts, and we shared a few veggie sides. The steaks were some of the best we've ever had, and we like our steaks.However, wine service nearly wrecked our dinner. We found it very difficult to find a wine we were looking for. Basically, we wanted a new world version of a Bordeaux grape or blend. The way the wine list is written - listed by price as opposed to style or region - without tasting notes - might make sense for those for whom the primary consideration when choosing a wine is price, but for those of us who are actually looking for a specific style of wine, it is confusing. We ordered a California cabernet franc, and without being able to get any additional information from our server, who wasn't interested in answering our questions, we assumed it would be a typical California cab franc - rich, lots of green vegetable and herbal notes, touch of black pepper. WRONG! The wine was so light as to be practically a rose. The sommelier - who finally saw fit to come talk to us - graciously agreed to take the wine back and recommend a new bottle - saying, "Yes, this is very different from the usual style!" Well, why didn't our server tell us when we asked, or why didn't he send the sommelier if he didn't know? When we described what we were looking for, he indicated two possible wines - a Chilean Cab Franc and an Argentine Malbec/Petit Verdot blend. We asked him to describe the two wines so we could decide which one sounded better to us. All he could come up with was "full bodied." To be fair, my husband and I are American and looking scruffy as we had been moving house all weekend, so perhaps we were judged as not being capable of understanding a more thorough description of the wines we were considering ordering, but in a restaurant of Hawksmoor's caliber and price point, I expect the sommelier to have a bit more willingness to talk about the wines and make recommendations based on what customers actually want, beyond just price and "full bodied," even if he judges those customers to be unsophisticated. And it being a birthday dinner, we had ordered high-end steaks, cocktails and mid-range wines, so it was not as though we had ordered burgers and "your cheapest red." I still don't know whether the issue was simply that the sommelier did not have a thorough knowledge of his wine list or whether he thought we were "the wrong sort" (based on his tone and body language while speaking to us), but either scenario is completely unacceptable for a restaurant that boasts about its superior wine program and that clearly put a lot of effort into designing a diverse list with so many choices.We ordered the Malbec/Petit Verdot after trying to extract as much information from the sommelier as we could about the wine, and unfortunately, it was also not right - it had quite a lot of residual sugar and tasted oxidized. Graciously, the sommelier agreed to let us order yet a different bottle, and we finally decided to just play it safe and ordered some Bordeaux because at least we'd know what we were getting in the absence of a sommelier willing to tell us more  - which turned out to be adequate but unremarkable.In all, the whole process of finding a suitable wine for our steaks took a very long time and we were the last customers to finish up. The server was kind enough to comp our dessert for us. However, as we were finishing up, a mouse ran across the floor. To be fair, it's an old, underground space and these things happen, but ICK!In all, I hope our experience with the sommelier was atypical, because I really want to like this restaurant. It's a cool space with great food and cocktails in an area of London where many restaurants are chains or overpriced tourist traps. Maybe I'll give them another shot for a future special occasion, or maybe not.

wWvLy69GnPiCmNZQ_QYMOQ.text: Amazing sunday lunch - huge portions but still enough room for the 'Crunchie' dessert which was unbelievably good. Also the definitely-not-rolos 'Tributes' are fantastic. Brilliant cocktails and reasonably priced wine available. I've also previously eaten at the bar which was just as good! Once you've added all that up it can be a bit pricey, but the Sunday lunch is currently £20 per person which is an absolute bargain given the quality of the meat and the portion sizes.

uC7ziLGO0UfkmfBDEhWnPw.text: Excellent steaks. I highly recommend the anchovy hollandaise and the stilton hollandaise. Nice pre-theatre menu as well.

rxh81Qvz-7t7Uj0e-haOug.text: This place is amazing. The waitress we had was so helpful and attentive. The wine steward also was excellent and helped us select an excellent wine that was reasonably priced. I had the filet. It was fantastic. The creamed spinach and chips were also delicious and plenty to share. My husband had the rib steak that was equally delicious. It was very crowded but we never felt rushed. Great restaurant!!

gedaHJvPSvGkEd-eEXfygA.text: This place is perfect. It has some of the best tasting cocktails and meat I've ever had. Your first impression of the place is that it is a very old style classy place and they'll definitely offer to take your coat as you walk in. You'll then be walked downstairs to the bar area, where you can enjoy a cocktail before being seated for food. My family and friends came here for Sunday Lunch and Hawksmoor didn't disappoint.I had a Mint Julep to start, they serve about 8 of them and some contain rum instead of whiskey. They are served in a metal cup, which is the perfect way to serve a Mint Julep. They also serve a drink called "The Zombie" and it comes with the warning that they will only serve you one since it's liable to knock you out, needless to say I'll be going back for one.The Sunday Roast is the only way to go on a Sunday. The beef was perfectly cooked and the entire table shut up once the food arrived, always a good sign.

qmcq4Hsgq31O_auO8h1zQA.text: The Meat Sweats give me a sense of both slight disgust and satisfying triumph.  After all, there's nothing quite like seeing the slight surprise on the waiter's face after seeing a fairly skinny guy pack away a 24 oz Porterhouse on his own.  I don't often eat steak out, partially due to the expense, but also because most of the time it's cheaper and better to go to a butcher and do it yourself.  However, with Hawksmoor...let's just say, more like...HawksMORE.Before I start, a word to the wise: the roasted bone marrow starter with caramelised onions is absolutely delicious (and is comically huge), but it is not advisable to eat a whole one before a large hunk of steak.  It almost killed me, and I had a meat hangover the next day.  I'm not even joking.My experience here was top notch from start to finish - the cocktail menu is really quite excellent and I'm definitely considering going to the bar here at some point as there are a ton of drinks I want to try.The main dining area has a nice, relaxing feel to it.  I particularly like the availability board showing the weights of the different cuts available.  Needless to say, the meat is fantastic - my rare T-bone was as it should be, melt in the mouth, full of flavour, and with a sumptuous cowglaze coating.  Ah, there's nothing quite like totally violating your Daily-Mail-Sanctioned-Red-Meat-Weekly-Allowance in one evening.Really excited about my next trip here - hopefully next time I'll be able to fit in a pudding too...

3FXKhUwCEz5xZf90XVTT5w.text: Ok, so rocking up at ten on a Friday night after a few lagers wasn't going to be the best introduction to the meaty joy that should be a night at Hawksmoor but, having been to a recent and successful Steak Club at their older brother in Liverpool Street, at least one of the gang knew what to expect.We went expecting the finest burgers, perfect post pub fodder, and were drooling at the description of the Third Burger, a rotating option aside their classic hamburger and the Kimchi Burger, a spicy Korean melange attracting Marmite-like attention from the reviewing community. This month's Third Burger was enthusiastically sold to us by our bubbly server, and promised a topping of pulled pork rib topping the Longhorn and bone marrow patty, enthusiastically moulded from the best the Ginger Pig has to offer.After that description we were sold. Draft brew (slightly too floral) arrived in pint pots which, along with the communal bar tables and the uber-friendly staff gave the reservation free bar area the feel of an up-market American frat bar.At this point our server, mortified, appeared from the kitchen to inform us of the end of the burgers for the night. Made fresh, the fridge was bare, and the burger had to wait for another day. Instead we went for the bone-in Prime Rib and the Porterhouse. Two full kilograms of meat serving to sate three hungry (slightly drunk) men. Minimum sides needed, the steak was sufficient.Many have tried to describe these steaks, I can't really see the point. Cooked perfectly, they're sweet and meaty joy. Start by imagining the best steak you remember tasting. Now imagine the steak that steak wanted to be when it grew up, and then you're part of the way there. The triple cooked chips were a little lacklustre and passed hardly noticed, though the bone marrow went alongside the steak perfectly.It's not the cheapest night out. A kilogram hunk of the finest steak will set you back around £65, though that should feed two (normal) people and you get a pretty decent list of smaller cuts, at around the £20 to £25 mark.If you're a fan of culinary subtlety (or heaven forbid, vegetables) then Hawksmoor isn't the most obvious place to come. And while I plan on bringing my other half here, it's not the most obvious place for a date night. Bring your friends instead, grab a hunk of prime rib, and settle down for a dose of the meat sweats.
